choices: Secret Story
1.content:
Lisa called up the next day, eager to take the job. Any job would have sufficed....a string of recent duds has led Lisa’s reporting career to lacking any uniqueness. Her akward inexperience didn't sit well with her boss but he was always in the mood to give her a second chance. Could this really could be a break-through for her job? Will Lisa find more there than just a few fat folks? We’ll have to find out…

It was Lisa’s very first day in the town of South Barkalow and even before she arrived she noticed the trends and differences of this town. For one, the bus she arrived on was very different from that of the ones you would normally see, the seats were widened to about twice the length and width, their was a scooter ramp up, and a miniature vending machine in every booth. Sort of how dinners used to have jukeboxes in the booths.

The bus driver was a man who easily sported over 500 pounds of weight atop his near 6 foot frame. The man smelled heavily of bread and cheese, Lisa cringed as she boarded.

Choices:

1. Start the reporting now and interview the bus driver!
2. Silently board the bus and wait to be dropped off at your apartment.
3. Speak with one of the passenger.
4. Decide not to board and call a cab.
1.title: All Aboard!

11.content:
Lisa interviewed Gus Harlem, the bus driver, after his shift was over. Gus was a tall, fat African American man who had been living in South Barkalow since he was a child, born and raised, now massively obese and near retirement he simply tends to the buses and tourists. His grey hairs curled out from under his mandatory blue bus-driver cap. His uniform was wrinkled and faded from the many washing it had endured; he had a weathered look to his eyes and face and his lips seemed to be frowning quite often, but when he did smile it invited anyone to talk with him.

Lisa and Gus were at the employees-only section of the bus depot when their interview started. Gus was at his lunch break too; leaving this poor man vulnerable to Lisa’s novice and shoddy interviewing techniques.

“So, Gus, how long have you been driving the Barkalow Town Transportation Bus?” Lisa inquired with her pen and pad.

Gus lumbered over to the vending machine and put in 75 cents. A turkey sub erupted from the huge mechanism and he took it back to his table, he sat across from Lisa. “Well,” He started off in a slow voice, a croaky voice. “I’ve been doing this ever since the Tourist Busing Plan was put into effect. I knew the Mayor’s brother, Ralph, and I was offered the job right away. I never really understood why we needed this though, makes us fat folks seems like we’re in some glass box in a zoo or something.” His words were shameless. “Wish those skinnies would get off their butts and do some walking themselves instead of talking about how lazy we are…” Lisa was a little embarrassed; obviously she was someone who would be, in Gus’s terms, a “skinny”.

“Well anyone can ride the busses, residents and tourists alike, it’s not just for tourists.”

“I know, but the only people you see riding them are people with cameras and crap. We shouldn’t even have tourists, we ain’t nothing special.”

“So I suppose you don’t feel very positively towards the Tourist Busing?” Lisa was dutifully noting down every thing he said.

“Defiantly not! Don’t know why ol’ Tom even started this junk.”

“Your referring to Tom Blank, the mayor I presume?”

“Yeah, Tom used to be such a smart guy, but with all those tourists waving money in his face I don’t blame him for snatching some…”

“If you don’t support the Tourist Busing then why do you drive one? Wouldn’t you be better off doing something else?” Lisa was curious as to why he was staying here if he hated the tourists so much.

“Well, it’s really a long story, best not told now.” Gus reached into his skin-tight pockets for another 75 cents. “Let’s just say I’m doing Ralph a favor...” And with that Gus tucked his hands in his pockets and closed his eyes. Did he just fall asleep?

1. Be persistent and find out exactly what Gus's relationship with Ralph is.
2. Don't bug the poor guy, let the interview end. Besides you have to get home.
3. Look for another bus employee to talk to.
4. Explore the bus depot.
5. Leave and get accustomed to the town.
11.title: My First Interview!

choices: "Och, yeah. ye better."
"Nae wi' 'at shape, yoo're nae."
"But we barely mit."
111.content:
Lisa wanted the information badly, so she asked, "Aww, come on. I bet you have so much to tell me. Can you please tell me more?"

Gus, waking up, said, "Oh, alright, fine. But we'll have to meet at a different place, since it's the evening. How 'bout, at Chunky's Seafood Shack?"

Lisa beamed. "Why yes, of course. Let's do that, then. Does 8:00 A.M. sound good to you?"

Gus was a saint. "Sure, sounds good. Well, have a good evening ma'am."

"Oh, you too."

And so, Lisa was walking on her way to the hotel, getting all of the sights in along the way. Everyone is huge, she noted. There were fat kids, fat teens, fat women, fat men, fat dancers, and even Fat Bastard.

"Och, if it isnae ye, missy!"

Ah, shit. He noticed me. "Um, hello, sir."

"Sairrr? SAIRR? Wa, aam a stoaner workin' scottsman haur, eatin' bairns an' ham an' whit hae ye."

Lisa wanted to get away from this man as fast as possible, so she said, "I'd best be going, then."
111.title: Gus, The Reasonable Fat Man

112.content:
The interview ended soon after that and Lisa left the bus depot to see the apartment she was going to stay in. It was around 1 o’clock and before Lisa arrived at the apartment she had to grab a bite to eat, Gus wasn’t the only one who was hungry for a lunch time snack.

The large town was bright and bustling with the residences roaming about. Each one fatter than the next, she planned to interview many of them, including that 2% of residence that wasn’t overweight, but for now it was lunch time. Every street was packed with a multitude of different places to stuff your face. The extra wide sidewalks and streets housed every type of restaurant you could imagine. It seemed that there were no other stores, only restaurants.

Formal restaurants, Italian bistros, Chinese, Korean, cafes, diners, and of course an absolute overload of fast food places. No wonder this town got so fat, but where these built before or after the residences started fattening up? That was a question the mayor would certainly have an answer for. Lisa traveled through a couple of blocks, just looking at all the people and places but soon enough she wandered into a small 24 hour diner called simply “The Regular”, it was just 2 blocks from her hotel.

The diner was a small, square blue building that stood between a huge supermarket that looked like a warehouse and a custom car dealership, defiantly out of place and dwarfed by the two buildings at its side. Lisa walked in casually, but before she even sat at a table she was attracting quite a few frowns from the customers. It seems as if anyone skinny was thought to be a tourist, and no one seemed to like tourists here.

Lisa was seated at a table far from any windows, or booths, the waitress led her to a two seat table in the center of everything. Most of the other heavy-set customers were in extra-wide booths on the sides of the diner. Lisa’s chair was thin and non-reinforced, like usual, it was as if this town was segregated between the fats and thins. Lisa could only imagine arriving at a fancy restaurant and the waiter asking you for fat or non-fat as opposed to smoking or non-smoking.

Despite the customers unified displeasure the waitress was very pleasant with Lisa. The waitress was a huge middle-aged woman, who was not only fat but also very tall. She looked to be about 6 foot and over 450 pounds, she carried a lot in her thighs but the rows of tables were extra wide, posing no obstacle. “Hello, I’m Sally and I’ll be your server today.” Lisa continued to look at the menu. “So dear, what can I get you to drink?” Her voice was quite and soft despite her largely daunting size.

1. "I'll have a milkshake please!"
2. Lisa curiously looked at the drinks on the Specialty Page. "Why do they call this drink 'A Meal in a Mug'?"
3. "I'm fine, just a glass of water will do."
112.title: A Bite to Eat at "The Regular"

choices: Leave the diner and head to your apartment.
Ease drop on the employee's conversations.
You smell a story, stick around for a bit longer.
1121.content:
The menu was huge novel compared to the ones people normally see at “conventional” restaurants. The beverage section alone encompassed three back to back pages. Needless to say most, if not all, of the drinks seemed to have a high calorie count to them. The most numerous and varied drinks on the menu were milkshakes and other high-calorie concoctions. The drinks were reasonably priced but it didn’t matter, Lisa’s entire trip was being paid for by the company and so all of her expenses, including food, was going to be charged on their credits cards, not hers.

“Just a banana milkshake for now.” Lisa replied.

“How much whipped cream would you like? Extra or double extra?” Sally dutifully asked, it was probably second nature for her.

Lisa laughed a little to herself. “I guess just extra.” Lisa replied with a smile. “Can I have a few more minutes to run by my order? I haven’t decided yet.”

Sally wrote down the order, “Of course dear, might I suggest our Filler Special, it’s on the 7th page, have a look!” Sally advised as she tucked away her pencil and walked back to the kitchen.

While flipping through the menu’s pages she pulled out her glasses and stumbled on page 7. To her surprise The Filler Special took up the entirety of page seven! The whole page was covered in choices of toast, drink, syrup and other things. The Special consisted of 15 buttermilk pancakes, a loaf of French toast, a five egg omelet with your choice of cheese and filling. And with that mega-meal came complimentary sausage, potatoes, and hash browns. “Oh my goodness!” Lisa thought as she read the list again. “How can anyone eat all of this? There is just so much food! It’s impossible!” Lisa thought.

The colorful pictures of the meal seemed to come to life and dance around, taunting Lisa’s reluctant attitude. “Try me! Eat me!” The voices chimed, Lisa though, ignored her hunger and she refocused on her journalism.

She pulled out her journalism notebook and jotted down another name. So far in her notebook were a list people she wanted to interview, so far she had written:

• The Mayor
• Thin Residences
• Tourists
• More fat Residences
And now she proceeded to add another important name, “Someone who has eaten an entire Filler Special”.

The meal Lisa ultimately ordered was a simple but hearty plate of silver dollar pancakes and two eggs on the side with buttered toast. For her it was defiantly a lot of food but when you’re getting your picture taken you might as well smile, and although she didn’t finish her plate completely she felt much more than satisfied.
1121.title: So Much to Eat!

choices: Ask about her weight - no time to waste!
Ask about her eating habits - subtlety can sometimes yield results.
11211.content:
Belly aching somewhat from her large meal, Lisa payed and left, resolving to walk to her apartment to plan her next move. She had a lot to do, and if there was a scoop here she definitely wanted to get at it before any other journalist snatched it from under her nose.

The weather had turned hotter than ever, making Lisa feel distinctly overheated as she walked briskly along the sidewalk; if it was this warm for her, she shuddered to think how many incidences of heatstroke this town saw yearly. Carrying around a five hundred pound body was a struggle at the best of times - under the summer sun it must be exhausting.

Her route back to her apartment led her through a small park, and as she walked along one of the extra-wide paths through the trees she was interested to spot what seemed to be a children's playground. It wasn't a playground like she used to play on though - a dozen low benches were scattered around aimlessly, upon which the children were lounging. Not a single one was running around playing tag or skipping, and the solitary piece of equipment was an old slide that looked like it was falling apart - all the kids were just sitting around and talking, occasionally reaching down to grab a snack from the many bags of junk food that littered the ground around the benches.

Lisa glanced around; none of the parents were anywhere to be seen. Weren't they worried about their kids being unescorted? Then she thought about it, and realised that in this town, abductions probably just didn't happen. Perhaps there were some benefits to this obesity thing after all, she considered wryly.
Actually, if none of the parents were around, this might be a great time to get an interview with one of the kids without their mom or dad interfering with the results. After checking her surroundings once more, she hurried up to the gate of the playground and slipped inside.

The nearest bench to the gate had one girl on it who looked perhaps seven or eight - it was hard to tell though. Her form was absolutely smothered in fat, rolls upon rolls sagging from everywhere on her body. Thighs as thick as Lisa's waist were forced wide apart to allow her vast belly room to sit, barely covered by a stretched 'Frozen' T-shirt - her massive rear spread out voluminously on the bench, buttocks spilling off the back even as her legs dangled over the front. She blinked through thick glasses at the approaching Lisa, face buried by chubby cheeks and a double chin which almost seemed to merge into each other.

"Hello, what's your name?" Lisa asked, smiling her most friendly smile as reached the bench. She hadn't even realised children could get so big before.
"Um, Clara."
"Clara! That's a nice name. I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions about your lovely town, Clara," she asked, still smiling widely.
"I, um, I guess so," Clara mumbled, scratching her belly with a hand almost buried by her own forearms.
"Great! Well first off..."
11211.title: Won't someone please think of the children!

choices: Ask about exercise - though it's doubtful she knows what it even IS.
Ask about her family - a little more subtlety to go on.
112112.content:
"...I was wondering about the kinds of things you have to eat during the day, Clara," Lisa said warmly.

The subject of food seemed to get Clara's attention, as Lisa could see her eyes light up from behind her thick glasses.

"Let's start with breakfast," Lisa began, taking out her phone to write down notes, "What do you usually have to eat in the morning, Clara?"

"Umm," Clara muttered, gently kicking her tree-trunk like legs, "a big bowl of chocolate cereal - sometimes two. And some poptarts, about three or four. Sometimes five. Some sausages and bacon too. And some chocolate milk."

Lisa blinked slowly as she jotted down the list. It was no wonder the girl was so big. "What about lunch?"

"For lunch I sometimes get pizza, or some burgers," the girthy girl explained, "or chicken nuggets. Sometimes all three. I always get them with fries."

Lisa bit her lip ever so slightly. "I see, and what's dinner like?"

"We usually order takeout for dinner," the girl answered, "Chinese, pizza, McDonald's...sometimes a couple of places, if we have the money."

Lisa's finger nervously tapped as she typed. "And dessert...?"

A grin crossed Clara's fat face, squishing up her cheeks. "Chocolate cake and ice cream! It's the best."

Lisa saw that coming. "Right...do you have snacks throughout the day?"

"Chips, chocolate bars, burgers, fries, pizza..." she listed, counting on her sausage-like fingers.

Lisa couldn't be surprised - that kind of diet would leave anyone looking like a human blimp. She looked up from her phone to see Clara scratching her titanic tummy while smacking her lips. Perhaps all that thinking about food was working up her appetite, Lisa thought wryly.

"Well, aren't you a lucky girl Clara," she managed to keep up the happy facade, "okay, next question..."
112112.title: Interview With a Chubby Child

choices: Get straight to the point - ask Clara if she knows why everyone is so fat.
Stay subtle - ask if she knows what 'overweight' means.
1121121.content:
Lisa wasn't at all sure the girl would even understand the concept of exercise, but she gave it a go anyway.
"How much exercise would you say you do on average each day?" she asked, trying to look friendly, inquisitive and genuine all at once.
Clara tilted her head slightly, looking confused.
"What do you mean?" she asked. As she waited for Lisa's reply she reached down beside her, pulling a couple of candy bars from a paper bag Lisa hadn't spotted before. She unwrapped one and ate half in a single bite, barely even chewing before she swallowed it down.
"Well, walking around, running, sports... that kind of thing," Lisa said, watching in genuine dismay as Clara quickly polished off both candy bars as she seemed to consider her answer.

"I don't really do a lot of walking," she admitted eventually, "Makes my legs hurt. Mommy teaches me at home so I don't have to go anywhere for that," she bit her lip, seemingly doing some serious mental athletics. God knew she couldn't do physical breed, so perhaps she was some kind of intellectual savant to compensate "I think I walk maybe... two hundred steps."
Lisa raised an eyebrow.
"When do you walk two hundred steps, Clara? To get to the park?"
Clara shook her head, looking amused.
"No, like... every week. I walk two hundred steps a week. With mommy's help."
Lisa's eyes widened.
"Oh. Right. That's alright," she managed to say, more than a little horrified, "How did you get to that number, can I ask?"
Clara rolled her eyes, apparently growing irritated by Lisa's questioning.
"It's like... 10 steps to go to the bathroom, and mommy takes me there two times a day... and then it's like... another 30 to this bench from the car... then 30 back again... and that's it."
She was beginning to get out of breath from all the talking, having to take breaks even within each sentence to grab some wheezing gasps. She was a surprisingly good interviewee though, so Lisa carried on with her questioning regardless.
"And would you say you do more or less activity than most children your age?" Lisa asked. There was a shifting in Clara's form, one that might perhaps be interpreted as a shrug.
"I guess about the same," she managed to say, eventually. She scratched idly under one of her fat rolls, her thick hand disappearing altogether as she rubbed at the inflamed, buried skin.

Lisa bit her lip. She had plenty more questions, but she wasn't entirely sure how many Clara could manage.
"This might be a sensitive question, Clara, so don't answer if you don't feel comfortable. I have to ask though - do you know how much you weigh?"
There was another shifting that might have been a shrug.
"Weigh? I dunno. Like, pounds and kilos and stuff? Mommy said I'm not learning that 'till the year after next."

Lisa wasn't going to find any useful leads there. She reckoned she could probably get away with a few more questions though as long as she was quick.
1121121.title: Continually Questioning Clara

choices: Ask if she has any hobbies - games, activities, etc
Ask if would like to do more than 200 steps a week
11211212.content:
"Okay Clara, a more important question," Lisa went on, darting her eyes quickly as she attempted to find the right words in her head, "do you know what the word 'overweight' means...?"

Clara blinked slowly, lazily picking her brain for any recollection of that word. Eventually, she slowly shook her head, causing her massive slab of a double chin to wobble.
"No, never heard of it."

Lisa figured as much - it seemed no one in this town had any idea what the word meant. She didn't want to be the one to explain it, in case she upset the girl any further...she'd have to be subtle a little longer.
"Would you say you're healthy?"

"Mommy says so," Clara puffed, taking a few moments to catch her breath from all that talking before continuing, "She says...a healthy, happy appetite...makes a healthy, happy girl...and she says I'm really healthy...and I'm really happy..."

Lisa actually saw the poor girl's forehead start to glisten with sweat. As she reached into her bag and pulled out a huge sharing-size bag of chips and poured a mouthful of its contents into her widened maw, Lisa could only watch while she thought of what else to ask.
11211212.title: Querying Clara Continues

choices: She supposes the fat girl has earned it.
No, too gross, and risky - what if her mom gets back?
112112121.content:
The hot sun above, as well as the strain of having to talk and exert herself, seemed to be taking its toll on Clara. Wrapped in all that insulating fat, Lisa wasn't surprised she was overheating, but she did feel it was a tad neglectful of her mom to leave such a vulnerable child out in the sun like this. She was sweating more heavily than ever now, great dark patches appearing across her stretched Frozen t-shirt to stain the fabric.

"Well, Clara, if you only walk two hundred steps a week, what sort of hobbies do you have? What sort of activities do you do to pass the time between meals?"
Clara looked thoughtful.
"I snack... watch tv... play games... snack... mommy teaches me... sometimes..."
She was having to take longer and longer breaks between sentence fragments to gasp for breath, wheezing so loudly some of the other kids in the playground looked over in concern. Lisa smiled at them nervously.
"Well, ah, what sort of games do you play?" she asked hopefully, "Board games? Word games?"
"Video... video games," Clara gasped, making Lisa's heart sink once again. It seemed this poor girl didn't do anything intellectual at all, besides her homeschooling - and if she still hadn't learned about weights at the age of seven or eight, she was rather skeptical that that was anything more than an excuse not to send her to school.

She tapped down the answers on her phone, but before she could pose another question, Clara spoke unprompted.
"Can... can I ask a question?" she puffed, blinking rapidly as sweat dripped into her eyes.
"Oh, of course," Lisa said, looked up in surprise, "What do you want to know?"
"Can you... scratch my thigh... under my tummy... it's itchy... can't reach..." she gestured vaguely to where the flabby mass of her belly rested on her legs, and Lisa was horrified to realise that her arms weren't long enough to reach. The reporter gaped for a second, then bit her lip. She supposed that the girl had answered all her questions fairly well - on the other hand, she'd always had a weak stomach, and she wasn't at all sure she could deal with what she might find.
112112121.title: Carry-on Canvassing Clara

choices: Lisa continues her questions before she lost Clara's attention.
She tries to interview one of the other kids.
1121121211.content:
Lisa gulped. Clara had answered her questions well, and she was being pleasant so far...perhaps she'd earned this. And she could always just wash her hands afterwards.

"O-okay, sure," she muttered, and took a deep breath as she eyed Clara's massive tummy, spilt all across her lap and heaving from its owner gasping and wheezing for precious air.
She could already see it glistening with the sweat appearing over the flabby dome. She had to remind herself that she could just wash her hands later.

She tried to think of how to do this, but it seemed the only way was to...lift up her tummy. The thought made her heart skip a beat.

Taking another deep breath, she reached a hand under the massive expanse of soft, sweaty flesh and raised it. Thankfully Clara was at least wearing shorts, even if they were badly strained and the legs were pinching so badly her thighs were practically bursting out of them.
She felt a little nauseous, her stomach already in knots. But she had to do this.

She quickly scratched on the massive slab of thigh, causing Clara to breathe a heavy sigh of relief. "Ahh, that's better...thanks..."

Not too quickly but still rather hastily, she removed her hand and gently lowered Clara's tummy before looking at her. Now that she was relieved of her itch, her eyes, already squinting from her massive cheeks, looked drooped, like she was about to fall asleep at any moment.
1121121211.title: You Scratch my Back, I'll Scratch your Leg

11212.content:
“She looks thin, too thin. Is there hope for her?” Sally asked. She and a few other waitresses were off on break chatting in the back, employee-only room. Lisa was nearby listening as best as she could, she could only make out a few words.

One of the people among the discussion was Rod Crewn, a middle aged bum who at 30 was cut off from his parent’s credit cards and money stream. He was a late bloomer of sorts who was working at the dinner for some much needed spare cash. He was only semi-portly despite being born and raised in South Barkalow, but his appetite was something many citizens yearned for. He’s claimed to have eaten out entire menus, and despite his constant bragging nobody doubts him. “I say tie her down and feed her till she pops!” He roared loudly with a grand, toothy grin.

Martha was a young, new employee who was far from being called the “new kid”. She was loud, lovable and a definite porker. She was a boisterous young girl who flirted with customers and she was somebody who didn’t mind going doing “over time” with employers to get a promotion. Everybody thought she was sleeping with the boss but she was so loud and friendly that she had no real enemies. “Oh don’t be so harsh Rod! She looks like a very sweet girl.” Martha seemed strangely passionate.

Rod recoiled back to the kitchen to pick up another round of food. “I was only joking…” He muttered knowing he should just shut up; since Martha knew almost everybody in town no one wanted to offend her. She was kind of like the popular girl in school.

Martha cleared her throat and continued. “I think we should be nice. Just coax her into it, I mean I was just like her when I came here, don’t you remember?” Everyone nodded. “I was skin and bones too…” Martha smiled. “Until you showed me that Filler Special!” She said smiling widely at Sally. “Offer her that!”

“I did!” Sally offered. “But she said no, I’m sure I can nudge her into it though.”

At that moment a tall bald man tapped Lisa’s shoulder. “Need some help miss?” Lisa was scared half to death as she quickly turned around.

“Uhh, yes I was just checking to see if my food was ready.” Lisa lied as she crept slowly back to the seating area. The man smiled, Lisa could tell he was annoyed but by no means suspicious.

1. Lisa decides to cut her losses and leave, what were those waitresses and waiters talking about? Does it really mean anything?
2. Although a bit shaken Lisa decides not to go to her apartment and instead travel around the town and start to get a feel for what she is reporting on.
11212.title: Some Things are Better Left Unsaid

choices: Lisa arrived at her apartment and checks out her room.
Upon arriving she realizes someone is waiting for her.
112121.content:
What Lisa had just overheard was unexpected and a bit bizarre to her ears, overwhelmed she pulled out her tourist map and began the short walk to her apartment.

Just walking in the city was a totally different experience then walking in your average city, although the sidewalks were appropriately adjusted to twice the normal width there weren't many people walking on them. Lisa had only seen a few and those who were promtly entered a nearby eatery or store.

No bike paths, no joggers, nothing of the sort, just long, empty, refreshing sidewalks. It was quite pleasant though walking along, the town spelt fresh and heavy in sweets and food. It wasn't quite like anything Lisa had experienced before, this city wasn't like others.

Not many loud noisy cars, no polluted air and fumes from factories either. Just sweet aromas and long empty sidewalks.
112121.title: Taking the Road Less Traveled, Walking

1121212.content:
The exterior of the hotel oozed opulence and luxury, the building was tall and grand, recently built was Lisa's guess. She carried with her company two suitcases filled with clothes and knick-nacks and with that she proceeded through the wide revolving doors. A fresh breeze danced by as she entered the lobby.

It was a large room with a lounge area and a receptionist desk, much like any other hotel. Lisa carried her luggage up to the receptionist desk were she was greeted by a young teen, no older than 20 but she looked to be at over 250 pounds, Lisa couldn't see her whole body but wasn't hard to tell that her bosom held much of the weight.

She has baby blue eyes and her blond hair pulled back into a long ponytail, she smelt of chocolates and mints, Lisa looked over to the courtesy candy bowl. Like most hotels at the desk was a candy bowl, but here it was more of a pit. The bowl was recessed into the desk itself and rather than tiny mints there were whole sized candy bars. Lisa's guess was that the receptionist had been treating herself to it all morning.

"Good afternoon, welcome to Summit Hills Hotel." The receptionist greeted vibrantly, her massive chest shook with each syllable under her red tight office uniform. Lisa noticed her name tag read Marie.

"Hi, yes I reserved a room here, I was told it was..." Lisa searched her snug pockets for the slip of paper her boss gave her - on it was her room number and password to get it. "Aah, here it is, I'm room number 12A."

"Ok, do you have the password for the keys?" Marie asked.

"Yes," Lisa showed her the paper and Marie input it, her computer showed confirmation. Marie handed her the card key to her room and explained the simple directions to get there. Lisa thanked her and grabbed a candy bar for later.

She saw a rack of brochures near the desk and opted to browse through a few. They were advertising different estuarine and tourist attractions to see, she grabbed one of each hoping some may be of importance and perhaps hold some valuable information.

Turning to the elevator she heard a voice across the lobby calling her name. She turned to see....

1. A tall figure across the room, he/she was waving and behind him/her was the same company luggage Lisa had. Had she been given a partner? Her boss hadn't mentioned this!

2. No one at all....hmmm...she swore she heard someone call her name. Oh well, probably nothing.
1121212.title: The Summit Hills Hotel

choices: Explore the rest of the hotel room.
Think about the day's findings and get to bed.
11212122.content:
Lisa scanned the room but couldn't see anybody. Dismissing it as her own imagination, she pressed the button and waited for the elevator to arrive.

A few seconds later the elevator made a noise, signalling it's arrival and Lisa stepped in. She was on floor A, the first floor up in the elevator so she pressed the button and waited for the metal box to travel upwards.

The elevator doors opened and Lisa stepped out into a long corridor. Walking through it she looked from side to side counting the numbers until she got to number 12. She stopped, took her keys and entered into the room.

Once inside, she was shocked to see how large the room was. There was a living room area, a kitchen area and two doors. Lisa guessed they went to the bedroom and the bathroom.

The living room area was pretty large but it was overshadowed by the kitchen area. There was an oven, a dishwasher, a large fridge, a sink and a lot of cupboards. Lisa walked into the living room and dropped her bags onto the sofa. She walked towards the kitchen and opened the fridge to find it filled with all kinds of foods, from snacks to ready meals.

Lisa closed the fridge door and looked through the cupboards. She found plates, bowls, cutlery and more food. There were snacks that didn't need freezing.

Lisa took her notebook out of her pocket and opened the page she had been working on, adding "Wide-selection of food in hotel room. The tourists aren't fat, why do they need so much food at the hotel?"

Lisa closed the notebook and decided to pack her stuff away and...
11212122.title: Room 12A

choices: Take a nap for now
Room service arrives!
112121221.content:
Since she had already seen the kitchen, she opened one of the other doors and found it was the bathroom. It was also quite extravagant - the bathtub was as big as a jacuzzi, with water jets for bubbles. There were full-size, not travel-size, bottles of lotions, shampoo and conditioner, as well as bars of soap. The towels were big enough to eat a picnic on. Lisa unfurled one experimentally - it was as light and convenient as a regular-sized towel.

That's weird, she thought. A towel this big should feel clumsy... I have enough trouble spreading out one when I go to the beach.

She opened the bedroom door next. The bed was huge. Not just extra large for a very full-bodied guest, but big enough so that even two very obese people could have plenty of room. She hopped on the bed experimentally, surprised to find a layer of soft comfort on top of some firm support. She lay down, humming to herself as she felt her muscles relax instantly.

She almost forgot her trusty notebook. Picking it up, she scribbled more notes. "Very luxurious accommodations. My editor either really likes me, or something weird is going on... also, everything seems built to handle very obese people, not just the kitchen."

I guess that rules out skinny people who win eating contests coming to visit en masse, Lisa thought, shrugging. Gosh, this bed really was comfortable...

1121212212.content:
Just when Lisa was about to doze off on the large cozy bed, she hears a knock at the door. She turns her head over to face the digital clock on the nightstand and reads 9:47 PM.

"Strange, who can that be?" Lisa gets up and walks over to the door to have a look through the peephole. She sees what seems to be a rather a bottom heavy brunette wearing a red uniform coat and black slacks, standing next to a tray. Still not very trustful of everyone here, she leaves the door closed and says in a confused voice, "Ummm, how may I help you?"

The brunette then replies in a cheerful voice, "Good evening Ms. Boytise. Sorry to bother you at this hour, but on behalf of The Summit Hills Hotel we would like to welcome you with a complementary dish form our restaurant." More calm and focused now, Lisa decides that this would be the perfect opportunity to start researching this town.

She put on a smile and open the door. "Well thank you very much." Lisa says to the brunette as she rolls in the tray. "Do you guys offer everyone that stays here this?"

"Of course we do." The brunette then began rolling the tray over to the kitchen. Lisa then saw how the slacks squeezed the brunette's chubby bottom half tightly, as she pushed the cart. "We want every guest here to feel like they would at there own house. If we can, we would like you to feel even more comfortable here than your house." She then reach over to the dish on top of the tray which let Lisa see some fleshy white fat ooze from the sides of the brunette's slacks as she placed it on the table. Lisa noticed the brunette's face turn red as the fat stuck out making a small muffin top. Lisa turned away a little so the brunette can hide the embarrassing fat that stuck out on each side.

Lisa than began to think to herself 'Odd, everyone in the town so far was used to their weight and didn't struggle with clothes, she must be new here. She seems to be barely reaching the 200 mark or just passed it. What keeps bringing people to this town? The service this town provides is great, but I doubt that is the only reason why everyone is drawn here'

The smell of pasta soon interrupted her thoughts and Lisa's stomach growled ready to eat. Being since she hasn't eaten anything since this morning, many would expect that reaction from her stomach. But Lisa on the other hand, didn't think she would still be hungry after being so full from the thick milkshake and hearty breakfast from this morning. In fact, she never remembered being hungry a second ago in bed. Before she could put more thought into what was happening, her thoughts were interrupted yet again.

"Is there anything else you would be needing?"

"O yes.." Lisa than began to focus on her assignment and started to do some investigating. "I'm still new here, so I was wondering if you can you tell me a little bit about this town and how you like it here?"

The brunette then introduced herself as Jasmine and spoke a little about herself.They both sat down at the table. Lisa with her big bowl of pasta and Jasmine snacking on a king size Snickers she saved. Jasmine rambled on for about a good twenty minutes, all while Lisa began nibbling on the pasta. Lisa started to get a little frustrated and bored when everything Jasmine said she already knew. When Jasmine started to talk about how she ended up in this town Lisa got interested again. Jasmine was telling Lisa how she wanted to be a model at first. Lisa could tell by Jasmine's face how she could have been a model before she was fatten up here. Jasmine also said it was funny she never even heard of this town before, until she got something in the mail from here six months ago. Before Jasmine could tell her more, she was stopped by the sound of Lisa's fork scratching against an empty bowl. Lisa was shocked to see she had finished the whole blow, and how she failed to notice the fullness in her stomach. Before she had time to collect her thoughts Jasmine was already up from the table.

"It is almost time for my shift to be over so I better get going. If you need anything else feel free to ask me. I'm usually working here or downtown somewhere." Not wanting to blow her cover as a reporter she just nodded and let her leave. As soon as Jasmine left with the tray and dirty dishes, Lisa walk over to the bed with both hands on her stomach, and dug her head into the pillow.

'Great, not only did I embarrassed myself by stuffing my face, but I blew a great chance to get a lead from Jasmine.' She laid in bed for a little bit trying to think of anything she could have miss from before that Jasmine said. But all that she talked about before, was common things she already knew about the town and all the new restaurants they had here. Lisa just buried her head in the pillow again and decide to call it a night.

1122.content:
Lisa pointed to one of the drinks on the menu. “Why is this called ‘A Meal in a Mug?’”

Sally smiled. “That’s something were actually famous for around here. Few years ago Hobs, the owner, decided to do something different with Thanksgiving leftovers and put turkey scraps, mashed potatoes and cranberry sauce into a blender and liquefied it. It grew to be very popular around here, so now we make it with turkey, mashed potatoes, stuffing, gravy, cranberry sauce and pumpkin pie filling. Good choice to start with, miss.”

“Wait!” Lisa exclaimed. “I didn’t actually want to order it…” But the waitress had already walked away, out of earshot. Amazing! Lisa thought. How could the fattest town in the world have a concept like leftovers?

Before Lisa could get over her initial shock a woman walked in and sat across from her. At first, Lisa thought the woman was skinny, but then she realized that the woman had a belly on her that flared out from her thin frame so ridiculously that she looked pregnant. But a pregnant woman, Lisa thought, wouldn’t be wearing things like a restrictive belt, a short miniskirt and thick soled combat boots. The woman appeared to be Lisa’s age or a year younger, and had shoulder length orange hair and the creepiest makeup Lisa had ever seen. She wouldn’t describe the woman as being goth, but she was disturbing.

“Shh…” whispered the mystery lady. “You’re the journalist that’s trying to figure out why everyone in this town is so fat, right?”

The surprise on Lisa’s face gave her away. She had only gotten into town today, and she was sure her assignment hadn’t leaked out of the company. The woman continued. “You can call me Tilly. And you are defiantly going to need my help.”

“Hey Tilly.” Sally the waitress walked past. “The usual?”

“Yeah. Make it cranberry juice this time.” Sally walked to the kitchen.

Lisa tried to regain her composure. “So, Tilly, you want to help me. Why?”

“Let’s just say both you and I have an interest in…secrets.”

“How did you even know that I’m an investigative reporter?”

Tilly smiled. “That’s just one secret you’ll have to figure out.”

Sally came back with a tray laden with drinks. “Here you are, miss. One ‘Meal in a Mug.’ Anything else to order?”

“No, I’ll just finish this first.” Lisa looked at the glass. It was taller than any other glass she had ever seen in a restaurant, and it was filled with what looked like a brownish-yellow milkshake. Sally put the rest of the glasses on Tilly’s side of the table. Lisa counted one chocolate milkshake, three glasses of cranberry juice, a glass of milk, a glass of beer, and a glass of water.

“Thirsty?” She smirked.

Tilly glanced at her. “I’m a bloater; someone who likes to bloat and distend their stomach with liquids. I can handle the big meals here when I have too, because of my large stomach capacity. Better leave this to the professionals.” She reached over and grabbed Lisa’s meal in a cup. Lisa stared in amazement as Tilly guzzled the drink and emptied it in about ten seconds. She reached for her pen and paper.

Tilly licked froth off her lips and shook a finger. “I wouldn’t do that. You might scare the locals. Just be patient.”

Over the next few minutes Tilly took deep, long drafts from her various beverages, mixing them up so she avoided the odd aftertaste that comes from mixing juice and milk. Finally she stifled a belch and patted a bloated gut. “So, do we have a deal?”

If I’m really going to get to the bottom of this, Lisa thought, it’ll help to have a local with me who knows the history. But how exactly did she figure out who I was so quickly? If I stay with her, perhaps I could solve more than one mystery.

“If you want to know the secrets come with me,” Tilly said.
1122.title: Weird Drinks and a Weirder Ally

11221.content:
Lisa and her new acquaintance Tilly were now sitting in a park a few blocks away from the restaurant. Although the park was situated in the fattest town in the world, the overweight citizens still partook in activity. However, it was food related activity. People were having picnics, barbeques, and ice cream socials. Lisa was surprised so many fat men, women, boys and girls could fit in one place. Even the babies were fat. A chubby bundle of lard was being pushed in a stroller built for twins. Lisa couldn’t figure out if the mother was pregnant again or if she was just fat like the rest.

Tilly and Lisa sat in an alcove created by pine trees. Being more normally sized the girls could hide in this place were other people couldn’t get to.

“So Tilly, tell me what it’s like living in the fattest town in the world—ah, dang it! Excuse me.” Lisa had been fiddling with a tape recorder without very much success. Then ribbons tape scribbled out of it.

“You are horrible at this journalism stuff,” Tilly commented.

“Hush it.”

“You don’t want to know much about me anyways. I’m just the girl that bloats herself up with water weight in the basement. People talk about doing kinkier stuff on the internet.”

“I’m not that kind of reporter!”

“I know. But if you really want to interview someone noteworthy, I can take you to them. Scratch that; I can take you to where they should be.”

After a ten minute walk Tilly led Lisa to the outskirts of a shopping district. It didn’t look particularly out of place to Lisa. It had shops, restaurants, out-let malls and other buildings generally associated with such complexes. “What’s so special about this?” she asked Tilly.

“Just one thing before I tell you: Do you believe in magic?”

“Huh?”

“This place is magical, because it tends to distort space and time around itself. Stare hard, but not too hard, and the answer will come to you.”

Lisa was tired of riddles. All right, she thought, I’ll play your stupid little game. She gazed ahead. A Green Mill. Nothing surprising there. Right next to it was an IHOP. Still nothing surprising. She continued looking down the businesses in the block building, checking off the list of franchised eateries in her head, until she realized that she had yet to see a single clothing, electronics or bookstore.

She gasped. “There’s nothing but restaurants here!”

“Ding ding ding!” Tilly replied with mock enthusiasm. “Two points for the reporter. This area is called ‘The Eats’ by the locals. It’s infamously known around the world for containing a branch from every operating commercialized food chain in the country. Although the Hard Rock Café is nothing to write home about; all the pins are just fat guys playing guitars.”

“Amazing!” Lisa said. “But why would so many competing restaurants be built here so close together?”

Tilly pointed to another building. “Have you ever seen one of those before?”

Lisa squinted up at the sign. “ ‘La Grub Shack?’ What is it?”

“The latest corporation to jump on the pita sandwiches bandwagon. No other building of it exists in the entire US of A. It is still in its testing phase.”

Lisa gasped in surprise again. It was very easy for her. “Is South Barkalow some kind of testing ground for soon-to-be chain restaurants?”

“It very well could be. Rumor has it the mayor accepts big offers from food corporations to test their new eateries in South Barkalow. That is how all this cropped up. As you might have guessed, most of South Barkalow’s economy is controlled by food business. Isn’t this lovely? Over four square miles nothing but restaurants. Let us go in deeper.”

Tilly led Lisa through the urban labyrinth of places to eat. Just like the park, this was probably the only place in South Barkalow where the citizens were dynamically active. Families of human walruses walked to and fro. They could have their choice of any cuisine: Mexican from Acapulco; Italian from Olive Garden; Chinese from PF Chang’s; or ice cream from Cold Stone Creamery.

“What about the healthier food chains, like Subway?”

Tilly shrugged. “Those places are not as ‘shiny’ or ‘clean’ as their counter parts back in the real world. I dare say the Subways here would not help Jared keep off those two hundred pounds.”

Although she was the most physically fit of all the citizens of South Barkalow, even Lisa was getting tired from all the walking she had done that day. “You haven’t mentioned much about this person we are going to meet. Is it some important official, like the guy who develops this place?”

“Nope; just another of the many consumers of The Eats. However, this one is a bit more interesting than the common fare here.”

Lisa was dying to know who she was about to meet. “You haven’t even told me what gender this person is. Who are we meeting?”

Tilly, as usual, did not give a direct answer. “It is not too much farther. In fact…”
11221.title: The Eats

112212.content:
“Right on time,” Tilly mused.

An old fashioned lime green Volkswagen drove up into an empty stall in front of them. Lisa thought it seemed a tad out of place in a town of fatties. It looked too small for the average obese citizen. However, a tall young woman did come out of it. While she looked to be about Tilly’s age, her appearance was even more bizarre, if that was possible.

She had a cute, chubby face covered in long brown hair. Her body type was pear shape, comically exaggerated. Not much fat seemed to grace her upper body, but below her chest line everything was big. A massive belly jutted out just above her hips, like a larger version of Tilly’s distended stomach. This was flanked by thick thighs, huge hips, and immense rear end. She also shared Tilly’s unique fashion sense: a yellow top was tied off just where her belly began. It was covered in ketchup and other food stains. Her wide lower torso oozed out of red hip hugging jeans. Jeans like these could only be found in the fattest town in America. Lisa had to stifle a laugh. The combination of clothes and body did make this girl look like bruised but nonetheless juicy pear. Lisa wondered how this stranger even managed to sit in her car.

She shoved a handful of French fries down her throat. Once her hands were free she crumpled the fast food bag she had eaten from in her hands. The pear girl shot Tilly a look that was both friendly and annoying. “Oh great, it’s you.”

“Howdy, Jumper. Lisa, this is Jumper, and Jumper, this is Lisa.”

Lisa gaped in amazement. “Jumper?”

Jumper sighed. “You tell her. I’ve got to stop here to pick up a pizza.”

“Jumper has a hobby that rivals mine,” Tilly explained. She walked over and opened the back door of Jumper’s Volkswagen. The back seat was littered with wrappers, take-out cartons, pizza boxes, bags, and similar trash. “Now pay attention, journalist. This could be important.”

“Hey!” Jumper yelled. She stomped over from the Pizza Hut she was about to enter. “I didn’t give you permission to touch my car!”

“Lock your doors, then.” Tilly lifted up a garbage can filled with burger wrappers. She spread them out on the lime green roof. “Call this the burger list. We have McDonalds, we have Burger King, we have Wendy’s, Hardee’s, Sonic, Jack in the Box, DQ, A&W, White Castle, Steak ‘n’ Shake, Checkers, The Original Burger Stand, In-N-Out…” She paused, and then spread out the last wrapper. “You actually went to Whataburger?”

Jumper shrugged. “I needed a change of pace.”

Lisa’s pencil had almost snapped as she frantically tried to list all the burger joints. “Have you actually eaten from all of those places today?”

“Yeah,” Jumper yawned, as if that was nothing unusual. “You know what clubbing or barhopping is, right?”

Lisa nodded.

“I do the something similar: restaurant jumping. Hence the nickname ‘Jumper.’ ”

“Why aren’t you wearing your trademark jumper, by the way?” Tilly asked.

Jumper grinned wickedly. “I’ll wear that at dinner time, when I really want to show things off. It’s not a true jumper anyways. I just wear a small sweater and a tight skirt.” She slapped her hip.

Tilly reached into the garbage can. “Oops! Almost forgot one: Big Boy.”

“You guys still have a Big Boy here?” Lisa asked.

“Yeah,” Jumper replied. “They’re trying to make a comeback.”

Lisa went back to the original subject. “So, you actually spend all your time going from one restaurant to another?”

“Pretty much,” Jumper answered. “Breakfast for me lasts from 8 am to 11am. Then I take an hour break. Lunch lasts from noon until 4, then I take another hour break. Dinner lasts from 5 until 10, unless I’m working. It’s nothing but a nonstop marathon of me eating or going somewhere to eat.”

Lisa glanced down at Jumper’s figure again. The girl’s enormous lower torso did look like the results from such massive binges.

“If you spend so much time here, why don’t you move in?” Tilly joked.

“I do live here! My house is just one block away from the southwest corner.”

Tilly returned the garbage can to Jumper’s car. She turned back to Lisa. “As you can see, Jumper here is quite the catch. It is a wonder she’s still single.”

Jumper laughed. “Yeah! Many a date has failed to keep up with me during a night on the town! Now can we flippin’ go somewhere to eat already? I’m only halfway through lunch and I’m nowhere close to feeling full yet.”

The trio walked along the sidewalk, passing fast food places in favor of casual sit-down dinning. Lisa gaped a nearby building. “Oh my gawd! You actually have a Hooter’s here?!”

“Not the place to go,” Tilly warned. “The Hooter’s girls of South Barkalow are selected for a more different taste.”

Jumper mumbled something unintelligible.

11221211.content:
Jumper spread some glossy prints in the space between dishes on the table. Lisa looked at the one thrust into her hand. It showed three men standing at the back alley of a restaurant. One tall guy in a black suit had his back turned away from the camera, but the other two were shaking hands. One looked like the chef of the restaurant. The other man was stout and dressed in a white suit which had the front partially open, showing a swamp of chest hair. The man had greased back black hair, a thin mustache, a golden medallion around his neck, and the biggest most ridiculous dark glasses ever.

“Who am I supposed to be looking at?” Lisa asked.

“The bald chef is just Louie Lasagna,” Jumper said with her mouth full, pointing with a chicken bone. She almost left a grease stain on the photo. “This guy is Emilio Gluttanos, Columbian smuggler and dealer.”

“As in drug dealer?”

“You tell me.” Jumper placed another photo in Lisa’s hands. In this one, Emilio was watching Louie and the tall guy unload crates from the back of a black van. “I don’t know what is in those crates, but I do know what Emilio smuggles around. Typically it’s minor contraband items like illegal cigarettes, bootleg, or rare and endangered plants and animals that he sells to the restaurants.”

Tilly reached out across the table. “Ooo, I like this picture.” The three figures were blocked out by a red, shadowy form.

Jumper snatched it out of her hands. “Shut-up! So what if in the heat of excitement I dropped my camera into my takeout pasta?”

“Although he is a criminal, he doesn’t seem to be that bad,” Lisa said.

“I know. He maintains the persona of a small time criminal to hide his major trafficking.” Jumper showed them a stack of documents. “These are building permits for many of the new franchises in the eats. For a man who only lives in South Barkalow two weeks out of the month, Mr. Gluttanos contributes a lot of money to the building of these fine establishments. Because of this, he has been able to set up a system so he can smuggle his big ticket items to through SB to the other parts of the US. He also launders mob money with these area restaurants.”

She presented another photo in front of them. This was a zoom in of one of the crates sitting by a truck. Although the word on the crate was upside-down it was still easy to read. ‘Explosivo’

“You may have already guessed, but that is Portuguese for ‘Explosives.’ I think it was a crate of hand grenades that he was transporting somewhere. And then we have this…”

She removed a vial from her bag and taped out a few crumbs of tan powder onto a napkin. Lisa craned her neck to see. “What is that?”

“I don’t know what it is but this is the closest Emilio gets to actual drug trafficking. I call it ‘Emilio’s Fat Powder.’ It’s an unknown seasoning made by traditional mumbo-jumbo means from wherever he gets the stuff that predates all weight gain powder. It’s very potent and highly addictive. One pound of this stuff can lead to a weight gain of tenfold. The higher ups in this town can’t get enough of it. It’s also used in many of the restaurants in ‘The Eats’.”

Lisa looked down at her sandwich with concern.

“Don’t worry, this place doesn’t use it…yet. I know all the joints that distribute this stuff. My only question is why he would bring something so valuable into the country and then just scatter it like bread crumbs to the birds.”

“Haven’t you told any of this to the police?” Lisa asked.

Jumper crumbled up the napkin and then hid it in her pile of chicken bones and other garbage. “The SBPD is too fat and incompetent to do anything about it,” she snickered. “I just need to get this info out to a third party outside of this town and let them deal with it.”

Tilly elbowed Lisa in the ribs. “I-I’m a reporter,” Lisa stammered.

“I thought so. Tilly said that a reporter was coming through town anyways. If you help me with my investigation, I’ll give you the story of your dreams. How about it?” She stuck out a hand.

Lisa shook it, then winced when she realized that Jumper’s hand was covered in grease.

Jumper stood up from the remains from her dinner. “We’ll, we can start first thing in the morning. Now if you excuse me, I have a hankering for BBQ, Thai, and pasta to fulfill.”

112212112.content:
Lisa, having finished showering, styled her hair for the day in the bathroom mirror. She glanced down to the page open on her day planner. Monday: Investigation w/ Tilly & Jumper. She had written this down last night. She hoped the pear shaped private investigator would get here soon. Yesterday, the three had split up after lunch: Jumper, to continue her massive restaurant binge; while Tilly went home to ‘keep up her bloat’ whatever that meant. Lisa had spent the rest of Sunday trying to investigate and interview on her own, but she wasn’t successful. Although she hadn’t to admit it she truly needed the help of her South Barkalow guides.

A knock came from the apartment’s front door. It was Tilly. “Rise and shine, sleepy head. Just because this is the fattest town in the world doesn’t mean everyone sleeps ‘til 11 am.”

“Just a minute.” Lisa finished her hair and then made sure that she had all of her journalistic gear. She stepped outside

Today Tilly had her hair pulled back into a fire-ball bun, showing evidence that her orange hair was dyed as she sported black roots. Her clothes seemed skimpier than yesterday, but she hid that fact with a large baggy jacket.

Down in the parking lot sat Jumper’s lime green Volkswagen. The owner was leaning against it, trying to scrape gum off of one of her sandals. She was also wearing the exact same clothes as yesterday. Lisa had the disturbing notion that the venus had slept in them. Jumper’s sunglasses glanced in their direction as the two approached.

“Being the nice, caring person that I am,” Jumper remarked, as she snorted back some snot dribbling from her nose, “I took the liberty of getting us breakfast.” ‘Breakfast’ was a lose term in the restaurant jumper’s opinion, as it consisted of two bags stuffed with nothing but breakfast burritos and a jug of orange juice for Tilly.

The bloater thanked Jumper for the juice before she settled into the back seat clearing a spot for herself in the junkyard of wrappers and cartons. Lisa winced as she entered the passenger side. The interior of the car and absorbed the stale aroma of meat and grease.

There was a noticeable sinking sensation as Jumper sat in the driver’s seat. Ol’ herbie was really too small for her, as her right hip took up part of the passenger seat, leaving Lisa squished between the door and plump skin. Luckily, the old model had its gearshift controls mounted on the steering column. Jumper adjusted the column to make sure that the wheel sat above her lap, and then they were off.

“Why do you drive a car that’s too small for your…physique?” Lisa asked.

“Don’t ask questions you don’t want the answer to.” Amazingly, Jumper had managed to unwrap a burrito with one hand and bite half of it off with one bite.

Although she had already gotten them breakfast, for the next three miles Jumper drove through every drive-thru they passed. After twenty minutes of these shenanigans she finally parallel-parked at the end of a block. Lisa was forced to hold all the fast-food bags in her lap while Tilly balanced and guzzled jumbo sized sodas.

Jumper placed her sunglasses on her head. She attempted to recline in the cramped interior. “You, as part of your shotgun riding privileges, get to be secondary lookout and food-pilot.”

“Oooh, that’s the funfest job,” Tilly cooed from the back.

“Food-pilot?”

Jumper nodded, tearing into her last burrito. She had eaten all of the breakfast she was supposed to have shared with Lisa. “I say sandwich, you say which kind. This could be a long stakeout so I wanted to be prepared. And be quick when I ask for the food. I could’ve crammed more in here if I didn’t have to carry you deadweights around.”

“What am I supposed to be looking for?” Lisa asked.

Jumper pointed to the end of the street. “Part of Emilio’s operation uses that brick building on the corner. Given the day of the week, Emilio will probably stop by before he goes to the X place.”

“X place?”

“Another building he uses. I don’t know whether it’s a safe house, hideout, or lair as I’ve never been able to follow him to it, but I think it resides someplace outside of South Barkalow proper.”

Tilly spoke up from the backseat. “You know, all those words mean the same thing.”

Jumper threw her wrapper at her. “Duh! They’re all the same because I have no idea what the place is used for.” She licked sauce off of her fingers. “However, there’s only a 66% chance he’ll be here today. I’ll give us two hours, maybe two-n-a-half, before I call it quits.”

“Won’t they notice us sitting in here for that long?”

Jumper rapped the windshield. “Didn’t you notice the tinted windows? It’s the only new thing about this car.”

“Still, it seems like a long time…”

“Obstacle of the trade. I’ve been on longer stakeouts before where it’s just me sitting in the car for hours on end..”

No wonder your fat goes right to your hips, Lisa thought.

“The bag from Noodles & Co, please,” Jumper demanded. “And I do hope you don’t have to go to the bathroom…”

Forty minutes passed like sheer agony for Lisa. The Volkswagen was incredibly stuffy and warm. Surprisingly, Jumper didn’t seem to sweat, until the plumper reached for a fallen french fry and Lisa caught the state of her pits. Tilly was perfectly fine as she killed the time by drinking beverages. All Lisa could do was stare at the building and eat. Jumper didn’t mind Lisa eating some for the fast-food. The journalist ate only from pure boredom. Together, the two added thirty sacks to the wrapper trash heap before something finally happened.

Lisa felt a rumbling vibration from Jumper’s flabby thigh before the raspberry blared out like a suppressed foghorn. She held he nose. “Grosss!”

Jumper shrugged it off. “Sorry. It happens whenever I eat chili.”

“Then why did you go and swallow three quarts of it?!”

“What? I like chili.”

“Gawds, it reeks in here! At least open the window some more.”

“Watch it…” Jumper trailed off. The sandwich she was holding slipped from her hand as she grabbed the wheel, leaving a fresh stain on her top. “There he is.”

On the other side of the street Emilio Gluttanos emerged from the building and crossed to a black GM. After a moment he drove off.

“Well, aren’t we going to follow him?” Lisa asked.

“Hush it, greenhorn. When trailing someone you leave them at least two blocks on strait ways.” Jumper drove out of the parking spot and accelerated after him.

Emilio liked to drive over the speed limit, as the stuffed Volkswagen had difficulty catching up to him. Three blocks ahead he turned right. Jumper followed.

As they rounded the corner Lisa saw the back of the GM head down another street. “There he goes!”

Jumper turned onto the side street, and then slammed on the brakes. Lisa and several foodstuffs were thrown forward. “What was that for?!”

The Volkswagen was already in reverse. “Different license plate,” Jumper replied. “Emilio went the other way. I don’t know if that was typical or if he realizes that we’re following him.”

“Could he recognize the car?”

“Possibly.”

“Possibly?!” Lisa shrieked.

“Okay, I know this is an old car, but I admit that it’s probably the only one of its kind in the area!” Jumper snapped. “Tilly, I’m going to drive lateral. Tell me if you see his car on any streets.”

“Ok.” The words had just left the girl’s mouth she pointed. “Bogey at nine o’clock!”

The car lurched into a tight turn, causing horns to blare from traffic in the intersection. Jumper muttered something to keep herself focused. They had lost considerable ground as the GM now raced several blocks ahead. By sheer luck they managed to keep it in their sights.

“Cheese balls,” Jumper swore as the GM made a faraway left turn. “There are exits to two different highways after that turn.”

“How will we know which on he took—” Lisa started before Jumper cut her off.

“Don’t talk to me while I’m busy concentrating!”
112212112.title: Gross Stakeout

A School
11222.content:
Lisa was following Tilly up the side of a bluff that sat at the southwest of South Barkalow. At some point in the town’s history, it seemed, the bluff had been covered with nature trails. Because all the citizens were so fat now and didn’t hike at all, the trail had become almost obscured by dilapidated undergrowth.

“Where are we going?” Lisa asked, trying to avoid clumps of nettles.

“Couldn’t tell you now: that would spoil the surprise.” Tilly reached into her immense book bag and pulled out a 2-liter bottle of Mountain Dew. She chugged some and continued walking.

“So how long have you lived here?”

“Several years ago, when I was about thirteen, my dad moved us here after my mom died. A friend of his said hundreds of job opportunities were being created here. Naturally, he was a beefy guy when we came here and he quickly got accepted. I was a skinny rail of a girl then, and it was the craziest experience. Everyone in town kept trying to get me to eat something, every minute of every day Even my dad started doing it.” She paused to loosen her belt, which was digging in to her bloated stomach. “Luckily, or ironically, you could say, I was able to make my bloating habit more public since the locals liked it when I drank in large quantities.”

They paused by some trees. Lisa leaned on one. “How’s your dad?”

Tilly giggled. “He’s beefier than ever, if that’s what you’re asking. He manages a contracting company. Just about every month some new house or eatery needs to be built and my dad oversees the projects. Upon my return from college I’ve lived by myself in my own apartment. In fact, it’s the same apartment complex where this investigative reporter recently checked in…”

The flippin’ –Lisa thought. Of course. She probably snooped around and noticed that I was coming, and then followed me to the diner. Her frustration subsided for a moment when she thought of something. “Who are the builders in a town of obese people?”

“Good eyes, journalist.” Tilly took another swig that finished her Mountain Dew bottle. “That’s where the 2% skinny people of the population comes from. Most of them are builders that the town constantly hires from other places. Just about any physical labor here is done be people of a healthier weight.”

The path was getting more and more overgrown, and Lisa was forced to stumble through the dent in the weeds left by Tilly. “Are you the only one that comes up here?”

“I’m more active and energetic than many of the people here.” She patted her swollen gut. “Most of the time this is just a pouch of air. I’ve gained a few pounds of fat during my life here, when I fill this great stomach of mine with food, but my weight is usually fluctuated by beverages. So yes, I’m probably the only one that comes up this way. This bluff is the perfect place to hide something in a population that would never think of walking this far.”

“Hiding what?”

“That is the big question.”

The reached the top of the bluff, where there were fewer trees. Behind them sat the town of South Barkalow, with its population of fatties that would never think of climbing a bluff. Because behind the bluff, under Tilly and Lisa’s feet, stood a large, imposing building.

Lisa gasped. “It looks like a…”
11222.title: South Barkalow Bluff

choices: They climb up a ladder and enter via the roof.
Someone is coming! Quick, down a hatch to the basement.
112222.content:
The building was long and only two stories tall. Lisa saw some yellow buses sitting in the meager parking lot. “Is it a school?”

“It’s the Institution, if you’re into those kinds of conspiracy theories.” Tilly unscrewed the cap of a 1-gallon water jug and took a long swig. “Did you have a camera with you?”

“Dang-it, I knew I forgot something! It’s sitting in my suitcase at the apartment.”

“You really are new at this investigative journalism stuff, aren’t you?” Tilly started down the slope. “We’ll have to come back sometime so you can get pictures. Or you could borrow some of mine…”

Five minutes later they were sneaking behind the utility buildings that housed the Institution’s electricity, gas and water. Tilly paused to look out across the gravel road that separated them from one wall of the building.

“Are there guards or something?” Lisa asked, readjusting her glasses.

“Not quite guards, but sometimes the Nurses come out to have a smoke.” She strode across to some bushes up against the building.

“Nurses?”

“That’s what I call them.” Tilly crouched and hobbled over to a basement window. “The moment of truth has arrived, journalist. What you are about to see is not for the faint of heart. Viewer digression is advised.”

“Come on, it can’t be that bad.”

“It’s not,” Tilly smirked. “But it might answer your question. ‘Why is everyone in South Barkalow so fat?’ My answer: they start them out young.”

Lisa gasped as they peered through the window. Through the distorted glass, she could just make out a room filled with desks. Little girls sat in this classroom, but they were not really ‘little.’ Every girl was a mound of fat that spilled over the sides of their desks. They all wore the same style of jumper, which was a pink and silver uniform that deliberately left their massive, flabby bellies exposed. They all seemed to be eating sandwiches. One lone man, in a white coat, walked up and down the rows over super obese girls, checking their progress with the sandwiches.

“That would be a Nurse, as I call them,” Tilly whispered. “It’s always men teaching the girls and women teaching the boys.”

“My gosh! Just what are they doing?”

“Proper Chewing Techniques, I would guess.”

“Is this some school built to make fat children?” Lisa asked.

“Is it?” Tilly winked conspiratorially. “The ‘specially gifted’ of South Barkalow’s youth come here as an alternative to grade school. Not everyone makes the cut, though. I had this one girl who was a neighbor of mine. At six she was quite the plumper. Was picked up by the bus that goes to the Institution and continued to do that her whole childhood. There’s a screening process where they determine which kids can handle gaining the most weight.”

“Don’t their parents know where their children are going?”

“This is the top academy here. It’s a privilege to have your children come here. Just don't dress them up and then wonder why their clothes don’t fit when they come back home. But that’s not a worry in the fattest town in the world, right? It’s not like they can make it out for parent teacher night, because they’re too fat.” Lisa had a confused look on her face, so Tilly continued. “The kids only change into their uniforms when they get here. I think the uniforms are kept so small is to keep track of their progress.”

“Progress?”

Tilly ignored Lisa as she chugged some more on her gallon of water. She shivered as she capped the rest of it. She patted her bloated belly. “Oh, yeah, you’re really hard now, aren’t you?” Tilly whispered to herself and her belly.

“Hello! Can we try to focus here?”

“Pardon me.” Tilly got up, rather laboriously. “Haven’t gotten it this hard in ages. Maybe you’re good luck or something, journalist. And to answer your inquiries, they track the children’s progress in order to start them on the experiments.”

“Experiments?”

Tilly ignored her again. “Dear me, how are we going to get in here?”
112222.title: They call it the 'Institute'

choices: Suddenly an alarm blares. The guards are after Lisa and Tilly!
Before they leave, they realize that they are locked in!
1122221.content:
Tilly found a ladder leading up to the roof. “Better get to the roof quick before we’re spotted. Make sure no one sees us.”

Lisa peered around the gravel lot outside of the Institute. Except for a few cars owned by the staff and the utility buildings the area was empty. She quickly shimmied up the ladder until her head it something hard: Tilly’s boot.

“Ouch!” She rubbed her head with a few hand. Her glasses had been knocked askew. “Why did you stop?”

“Well, this is going to take longer than expected,” Tilly replied in her characteristic deadpan.

“Hurry up! You’re the one who said this place is top secret and it’s dangerous for us to be here and everything. Move it!”

“Sorry for the delay, journalist. I just usually don’t go around climbing ladders when I am at maximum bloat.” True, the distended belly of the young woman filled the space between the rungs of the ladder. Tilly was forced to lean back her arm’s length away for the ladder so she could actually climb without any obstructions. And don’t forget, combat boots with two inch thick soles were never made for ladder climbing.

Finally the duo made it to the roof. Lisa had spent the whole climb resisting the urge to look up and check Tilly’s progress. If she had looked up, she would’ve seen what was under Tilly’s skirt. However, she wasn’t in the best shape to quickly scale a two story ladder either. She panted as she reached the top. Tilly had passed her time waiting by emptying a can of root beer.

Lisa wanted to slap the can out of her hand. “Don’t you think you should wait for yourself to…yah know, settle a bit before you continue drinking? That water balloon gut of yours could get us into more trouble.”

“I’m perfectly well aware of the risks. But I’ve snuck into this place loads of times so I know how to stay hidden.” She opened up a panel on the roof which dropped down to a dark metal corridor. Tilly led Lisa down the metal catwalk, soft clangings following their footsteps.

This is just a service corridor,” Tilly explained. “They only come up here to check the power lines for the main labs.”

“Lab? As in laboratory?”

“Yep. You remember the kids downstairs? This is what they fatten them up for.” They peeked through a large window into another room bellow. A room that was completely different from the one they had seen earlier. A few Nurses stood monitoring a trio of children. A fat blubber ball of a boy was running on a treadmill, covered in wires attached to a heart monitor. Nearby an immense girl of unknown youth sat on an operation table. The obese schoolgirl nearly occupied the whole table with her girth. A nurse was giving her a shot. Right next to her another girl of almost equal size was being measured on a scale.

Lisa surveyed the eerie scene. “What are they doing?”

Tilly shrugged. “Nothing too horrible, they think. First they stuff the donkey with carrots and then bring down the stick. It seems when the students here grow to a certain size they start them on the regimen and test the new drugs on them.”

Lisa stood for a moment as her mind put the puzzle pieces together. Her jaw dropped down in shock as she realized the picture they formed. “You mean to tell me the reason South Barkalow is so fat is because they test weight loss drugs on the kids?!!”

Tilly nodded. “How ironically counter-intuitive. I found this part out by accident. I noticed some of the fattest kids that I had been chronicling suddenly disappeared. They’re actually transferred to the old wing of the school where they become enrolled in the Institute’s Boarding School program. There all of them undergo the same diet and exercise regimen. Each student is relegated to a different experimental drug and their weight loss is closely recorded.”

“But what happens to the students after that?”

“Depends. They successful ones return to their family as skinny children but that doesn’t last long in this neighborhood. The students on unsuccessful drugs or those that rebel are sent away quietly. Dumped into foster care or state mental houses or family members if the risk of discovery is low. They have a hat filled with hundreds of excuses as to why parents may never see their children again.”

Lisa gasped. “But that’s so horrible and it sounds illegal! Don’t the parents notice that their children are missing?!”

“It’s only a small percentage of children that actually make it this far in the program. Usually the regular students have in-school physicals twice a month. Their weight is also tracked, because they also have test chemicals put into the students’ food.”

“These,” Tilly tapped the window, “are deemed the best guinea pigs of the bunch. If my counting is right there are never more than twelve students on the program at one time. A dozen may have one or two sour apples and that is when they are dealt with. Most of the time they students are just back to regular schooling like South Barkalow Elementary. Who’s going to believe a bunch of kids that claim they were ‘abducted by aliens’?”

Lisa gazed down at the children. The girl being weighed was now undergoing the pinch-caliber test. She winced as the metal tongs griped her flab. “It’s still a horrible thing to do to children…”

“True, but this is only the operation at the elementary school level. There are quite a few more answers as to why South Barkalow is so fat, hiding behind the trees. First, we have to get out of here.”
1122221.title: Is there a Conspiracy?

They manage to escape.
11222212.content:
Lisa walked back to where she and Tilly had entered through a roof panel. Standing on tiptoe, she tried to budge it open.

Tilly gave her a funny look. “You do know that is a ceiling tile, don’t you?”

“I knew that.” Lisa, embarrassed, tried to hide her blushing face. Tilly walked over to where the roof panel was and pushed up. It wouldn’t move.

“Figures it decides to stay shut.”

“You mean we’re stuck in here?!” Lisa yelled.

Tilly motioned her to be quiet, as they were still sneaking around a dangerous place. “Hold your horses, journalist. I’ll just give it a few more shoves to make sure—oh dear…” Tilly was frozen in mid-shove, her back arched and squishy middle throbbing. Lisa could swear that her guide’s middle was pulsating.

“What’s wrong?”

“Oh nothing, I just got the shakes. We won’t be able to leave the way we came, however. Now if you excuse me, I have to pee like it’s nobody’s business.” Tilly strode off.

“What?!” Lisa shrieked, before she remembered where she was and dropped to a whisper. “You can not be serious. I told you something like this would happen if you kept up your guzzling.”

“Cool your jets, Boeing.” Tilly entered a bathroom down the hall and Lisa followed. “So it is an occupational hazard of mine. I’ll be done in just a few minutes. Now, are you going to join me or are you going to keep watch

~~~

Down below in a remote security station, a guard lifted his legs from their resting place. “Hey George, you want to take a look at this?”

His superior walked over. “What’s up?”

“We got a spike on Toilet 15 up on the roof access hallway.” He pointed to a flashing light on a screen. “It measured urinary waste of almost two liters on its last flush.”

“What, again? That’s the fifth time this month we’ve had that occurred in one of the toilets. What’s going on?”

“Need me to send someone up to look at it?”

“I don’t think so. It’s probably just one of the janitors fleshing waste through the pipes like they shouldn’t.”

~~~

Tilly emerged from the stall, already downing a gigantic bottle of orange soda.

“You’re pathetic,” Lisa commented.

“But see, we still haven’t been discovered yet. Now come on Boeing, let us jet.”

“My name is Lisa!”
