Lisa tries to escape on her own
112222121.content:
Lisa leaned against the door to the hall and peeked again, down the hall a very large woman in a grey uniform came out of a room holding a clip board and slowly waddled down the hall towards Lisa while reading from her board.

"Hurry up Tilly! There's someone coming down the hall!" Lisa panicked as Tilly washed her hands

"Relax, journalist girl" Tilly mocked "If you're going to make a living as an investigative journalist you're going to get a hold of your nerves, just because there is someone in the Hall doesn't mean they are coming in here. Now let me fill up a couple bottles of water, I need to keep maximum bloat for at least another hour if I want to keep my progress" Tilly patted her still swollen belly "One day I'll have this baby so big people with think I have a real baby in here!" Tilly laughed as she filled her bottles in the sink "maybe even twins!"

Lisa sighed in frustration, she was really uneasy being here and just wanted to get back to town. "Fine, grow your stupid swollen gut, I'm going to try to force that hatch again" Lisa growled pushing past Tilly and climbing back up on the toilet's plumbing and then the stall walls to reach the loosened ceiling tile.

"That may not be possible" Tilly called after her "it doesn't matter though, I know 50 ways out of here, worst case scenario we'll just have to wait till the institute closes and sneak out when they cl-" Tilly stopped cold

Lisa finished climbing into the ceiling and turned to look at Tilly who left her thought unfinished. Lisa's heart stopped as she looked back into the restroom to see Tilly frozen in place as an equally stunned guard woman stood in the door looking back at Tilly as a moment of awkward silence passed.

"Hey who are you?!" The woman suddenly demanded of Tilly moving towards her

Tilly dropped her bottle and sprinted for the stall she and Lisa were using as a ladder with the guard in pursuit. Tilly scrambled onto the toilet but her massive gut betrayed her by preventing her from pressing herself against the stall wall enough to kick her way ontop. Lisa freaked out, to afraid to offer Tilly a hand for fear the guard would see her. Tilly was yanked from the toilet by the large woman with ease using her bulk to weigh Tilly down and counter balance her by easily twice her weight. Tilly looked up through the crack in the tiles at Lisa with hurt eyes as Lisa still stood by watching Tilly get wrestled to the floor.

The Guard rolled on top of Tilly and pinned her down as she radioed for back up "Control, control this is Fitzgerald, we got an intruder up on the roof access hallway in the womans bathroom. Send back up ASAP"

Lisa remained frozen in her perch and watched as Tilly struggled in vein against the woman's size until two more guards showed up both close to the same size as the first. "She was trying to escape through that tile" The first guard said and pointed towards the tile Lisa hid above as Tilly was bound by cable ties and hauled out by one of the extra guards.

Lisa almost screamed when she saw the smaller of the two guard reluctantly take on the task of climbing onto the toilet to check the ceiling for anyone else. As the Guard's head poked up through the tile just barely enough to see Lisa has already clamored down the cat walk far enough into the dark shadows to avoid being seen.

"Nope" The Guard said coming down off the toilet breathing heavily "I don't think she was trying to smuggle any of the kids out, or at least she must not have gotten to any yet" He gasped needing to sit down on the toilet to catch his breath.

Lisa crawled through the ceiling as quickly as she could her mind racing.

"Where am I going to go?"
"How am I going to get out?"
"What will happen to Tilly?"
"What will happen to me?"

Lisa was on the verge of crying, she was way in over her head. Till now she had been getting by from Tilly's bravery and bravado in the face of danger, now without it she felt so vunerable. What's more her source of courage was pulled kicking and screaming out of the room by a guard, this crushed any hope she had of finding a backbone seeing how much good Tilly's nerves of steel had done her.

Lisa bit her lip and pounded her hand on the catwalk "Damnit Tilly! This is all your fault! Why did you bring me here?!"

Lisa looked around, in anycase her only way out may rest in Tilly's hands.
112222121.title: Caught!

choices: Lisa Desides to try to save Tilly
Lisa Decides to run for it and try to find help (Tilly is experimented on)
1122221211.content:
Lisa had no choice she had to keep up with Tilly and bust her loose. Lisa leaned over the catwalk and removed a ceiling tile and looked down into the space below. She was above the hall and at the far end she could see Tilly being drug on her heels by the guard around the corner. Tilly's body looked limp and she didn't seem to be putting up any resistance anymore. Along side the two a large woman in a lab coat followed the escort with an empty needle in her hand, presumably the reason Tilly was now so docile

Lisa was in luck, A staff of overweight workers and test subjects most of which were as wide as they were tall meant stairs were a waste of space and elevators would strain if they were over used or moved to many people at once. To this end the building had been designed to keep most of the labs for child testing on the bottom floor with most of the research labs on the second and basic utility's housed roof access floor. In order to move personnel about the building's design has somewhat of a screw design where the building slowly wrapped around a central point in order to reach the second floor with a minimal effort. This meant Lisa could remain in the ceiling along the sloping hall as she moved down to the second floor following Tilly.

After rushing along the cat walk for a short burst to catch up Lisa mustered her courage and peered down into the floor below once more. To her dismay there was no one to be seen in the hall. Returning to the cat walk Lisa looked around her at the various ceiling tiles.

"She must be in one of these rooms..." Lisa thought

Lisa balanced herself on a support beam and crawled out above the tiles on one side of the cat walk. Lisa leaned to one side and looked in, Nothing more than an empty Lab. Lisa hauled herself back up on the beam and leaned over the other side and lifted a tile to look in the room next door. Inside a young girl of no more than 10 was sitting on a table nearly pinned by her own weight. No more than maybe 4 feet tall she was easily tipping the 200 pound mark. A large man in a lab coat was standing over her making notes on a pad as she drank from a tube with a thick yellow liquid. Periodically the man would pull the tube from the girls mouth causing her to momentarily whine and beg for it back before returning to her eerie zombie like state, once the girl had calmed down the man would offer he an eye dropper of liquid to taste then present her with the tube from before along side a new tube filled with the liquid she tasted. Each time the girl would look them both over before passing up the new tube in favor of her previous one and return to her content state of sucking on the liquid as the man scribbled down more notes. Lisa was a little unsettled by the liquid's resembling color to that of fat cells but didn't have time to wonder, she had to find Tilly.

Lisa slid back onto the beam and crawled back to the catwalk and moved out to the support beam on the other side. Lisa crept along the beam and looked into another room. In here she could see a boy and a girl both close to the same size but not quite as fat as the girl in the previous lab. The two were eating from a metal tray covered with various fattening goodies such as fudge or pastries aside a tray cover ins healthy fruits, both were practicaly inhaling the sweets despite the fact that each time they went for another the metal table they sat one would deliver a mild shock. Eventually the two emptied the tray and a man in a lab coat came to swap it for a new one, as they waited the girl dared to try one of the fruits and was surprised to find she received no shock for trying one the boy joined in and tried one as well. The man in the lab coat returned with a new tray of sweets. The two looked at the two trays considering which to eat. The girl picked up a fruit and looked at it, the boy picked up a sweet and also considered it but was given a mild shock for touching the tray of sweets. The two sat thinking for another minuet before both made their choice, the boy ate his sweet and the girl dropped her fruit and started taking food from the sweets tray despite the shocks, meanwhile the men in lab coats wrote down a storm of notes regarding the situation. Lisa shook her head in disappointment and got back onto the beam and looked into the room on the other side.

Lisa was relived to see Tilly sitting in the room but deeply worried by her condition. Tilly's eyes were half shut and stared into the distance, her head slowly swayed from side to side as two men stood over her asking her questions.

"What are you doing here?" asked one sternly

"...I'm.... showing that... Woman around...." Tilly replied in a far off detached tone to drugged up to think for herself, all she could do was answer their questions

"Woman? That reporter? Are you saying that reporter is here?!" The second man asked sounding agitated

"Yeeeeeessss..." Tilly slowly told them

"How does everyone know about me already?!" Lisa yelled inside her head upset she barely got here and was already so well known.

"And what about you??" The men went back to questioning "Our records show you live in town! Are you trying to help her bring us down?!"

"No...." Tilly explained plainly "She... was curious... I was just showing her... this place...I... don't care... what she does...."

"Is that so..." The second man started in before holding up Tilly's hand bag full of liquids "So what's all this then? Are they part of some plan to ruin all our tests? Why are you carrying this?"

"No... those are for me.... I drink to bloat.... I enjoy swelling up with the fluids...." Tilly answered in a dreamy voice

"Bloat...? You can't be lying... show me..." The man ordered

Methodically Tilly leaned forward and took the bag taking a 2 liter bottle of grape soda and began to suck it down in one long chug. The men watched in shocked awe as she took a second bottle out of ginger ale and repeated the process her belly swelling out giving her the look of having a chubby pot belly. Tilly placed the bottles on the floor and began to remove a third jug of root beer but the man stopped her

"Ok we get it, don't pop yourself..." He told her

Lisa thought hard, how was she going to get her out now? "They know about me... they know she knows about them enough to bring me here... they'll never let her go now... and they'll be looking for me... even if I return to town they may come looking for me..." Lisa shut her eyes and tried her hardest to come up with a plan.

Lisa look to the door the guards left through, no way the mirror beside it was for looks, they had to be behind it. Lisa could jump down and just grab Tilly and run, no way they'd be able to keep up...

He had long grey hair handing down from the sides of his head running down his back with a bald spot on the top of his head. The large doctor began to wheel himself to the door and snapped his finger at the two men who had been questioning Tilly who followed the large man out leaving the room empty.

Lisa slid the tile open more to make room to lower herself in. Lisa began to shift her weight over the beam when the door reopened. Lisa quickly hopped back onto the beam and looked down. Back in the room however the guard was beginning to wonder if the tile had always been askew when the young Dr. Gregs re-entered the room and broke his train of thought.

"doctor if I may be so bold this girl is very pretty" The Guard next to Tilly began trying to make this sound as entertaining as possible "We will have full control over her once we give her this drug.... what if.... what if when she is ready for reprogramming we were to make her... somewhat more... friendly... you know what I mean?" The guard asked with a broad smile as his partner closer to Dr. Gregs just smiled weakly

Living Large in South Barkalow
by Lisa Boytise, Staff Reporter

When it comes to this town, there's certainly a lot to love! I myself was rather skeptical - as a weight conscious woman, even visiting a town with a 98% obesity rate seemed risky. But after just a short stay here, I quickly learned why the town's population just keeps on growing with both newcomers and extra pounds!

"Eat up, hon, you're looking better every day!" Sally, a wide waitress at the local diner The Regular greets a gaining customer. Everyone here is super-friendly, brought together by the superb food served up nearly everywhere - it's hard to imagine how any city can keep its residents well-fed without bringing to the table as many fine eateries as South Barkalow does! Even a short walk will tempt you with pastries, burgers, pasta, even exotic fare such as Indian food and seaweed ice cream! To be out and about here is to be reminded of food.

While my slim frame initially got many strange reactions from the locals, which I first took as disapproval, I was relieved to find out that they were, in fact, concerned for me.

"Especially on a newcomer - it seems like a cry for help to us," says Bubba "Blubber" Boysie, city councilman.

But all that changed once I first bit into some of the local fare. The Regular's Fill'er Special was so good, I wished my stomach was super-sized just so I could finish it all and have a dessert! Even though I was stuffed, I couldn't help but nibble on some of it as I waddled back to my hotel room. The number of eateries isn't just for show - they all compete to put out only the best food for the ravenous population, meaning only the highest qualitiy and most generous restaurants stay in business.

"Our caring community is what makes us an ideal location for families - especially large ones," declares Blubber, before discussing plans for new housing, daycare, schools, and of course, eateries.

"I became about twice my original weight after I had my first child," says stay-at-home mom Debbie Doubledecker as she bakes some cakes as after-school snacks for her three daughters. "And I wasn't skinny to start. But after my husband got transferred here, I realized nobody cared as long as I was happy! So we just went ahead and finally had the big, happy family we always wanted! I'm thrilled that I can give my little girls the joyful, well-fed childhood I never had, growing up in some fatphobic town. In fact, though I never thought I'd say this, I'm proud that the reason I've gotten even bigger lately is because I'm expecting twins any day now," she proudly pats her considerable mother's belly. Though her body looks like that of any other local large lady, her motherly glow is obvious, and lovely.

And all the children of the town are given the best education in the state. "90% of high school graduates get into top-level universities, and lemme tell you - they don't even have to worry about the freshman 15 when they've already gained it here!" jokes portly principal Guy Lovehandle. "We've even attracted some of the biggest names in education for our top school, South Barkalow Academy, where only the most gifted students attend."

"I had no friends at my old school," says 5th grader August Bukkit. "But since I came here, I've made lots of friends, I'm getting good grades, and I'm trying out for the junior sumo team next year."

It's been about a week now, and I don't know if it's the five or six pumpkin pies in my stomach talking, but this town has grown on me as I've grown in it. So there you have it. I have no more stomach for the scrawny life. I'm going to start living to the fullest and fattest in the fastest growing town in the USA!


Lisa got a lot of work writing columns for the town's paper, Chewin' The Fat. Though it was mostly propaganda about how wonderful it was to live in such a tubby town, she was paid very well and her work was so popular she soon became one of the town's minor celebrities. Her salary, the hypnosis, and the free food from the grateful citizens quickly allowed her to become even larger than most townspeople. Her fame, combined with her size, made her one of the most eligible bachelorettes in the city! And after she was married, she continued to write even as married life and having several large children grew her body even more, and her gain shows no signs of stopping yet. Not surprisingly, the article sparked a huge interest in the town, and the population seemed to double overnight. Though there were a few people here and there who felt that something was wrong with this place... too good to be true, really. But most ignored that as paranoia. The few who decided to give in to curiosity found that they actually loved living in that town. In fact, more than ever before!

“Put her on the same drugs as her friend and give her a feeding tube.”

“Really, Doctor Wemble?” Dr Gregs looked at his superior with surprise. “I thought you specifically wanted this bloater intruder on a specialized experiment.”

“True, but that doesn’t mean we can’t have a control subject, can we? Remember, Dr. Gregs, we wanted to test this charming young lady’s stomach capacity that had resulted from her ‘bloating’ activities. This intruder…” The doctor rotated his cart until he faced Lisa, “appears to have a similar build to our first subject. By viewing this subject’s response to the same treatment, we can better understand the unique traits possessed by our ‘bloating beauty’ over there. Prepare the chemicals, Dr. Gregs.”

“Yes sir.” Both doctors left the room but the younger doctor returned a minute later. He wheeled in a device similar to the one Tilly was attached to. Picking up a green vial, he inserted a syringe into it. Lisa winced as he held it up to the light.

“Scared?” the man chuckled. “I’ll start you on the gallon treatment first then.” He held back Lisa’s head so it couldn’t move and applied a tube into her mouth. Lisa wanted to gag at the taste of the goopy substance that flowed down her throat. Once he made sure the restraints were secure, Dr Gregs picked up the syringe again. He was just about to insert the needle into Lisa’s skin when…

“Doctor!” A red-faced thick woman dressed like a teacher slammed into the door frame. She was puffing heavily. “It’s *huff* Stacy… she *huff* escaped again!”

“That rouge girl that we removed from the program? She’s only six years old and weighs 130 pounds, how could she possibly escape?”

“The *huff* ventilation grill in her *huff* room was removed. She must have *huff* through it—”

“She’ll probably get stuck. Still, alert the security. I want to see exactly how she was able to remove the grill in her room.”

Lisa was left in relative silence. Tilly was unresponsive in the chair next to her. The only sounds were the pumps at work, filling the pair with the disgusting liquid. Lisa would have groaned but she might choke on the infernal stuff.

That was when she heard the dull thud. It sounded metallic but muted, as if someone had dropped a cymbal out in the hallway. Lisa strained her head to see. Then there was a sharp creaking noise right by her ear.

To Lisa’s utter amazement a girl was wriggling her way out of the confinement of a ventilation shaft. Was this that escapee, Stacy, they had mentioned earlier? The young girl did appear to be 130 pounds as she struggled to budge her way through the grate, inch by inch. Finally the girl popped out with a splurch noise, the air finally making its way back through the vent.

Lisa tried to talk with her eyes. Please, untie us! Can you be a good girl and untie us? We have to get out of here!

The escapee, Stacy, seemed to understand Lisa’s silent pleas. The girl waddled over and unbuckled the strap restraining Lisa’s hand. Lisa pulled the tube off of her and together the two unclasped all of the ties. Lisa rushed over to Tilly’s side and freed her.

“Tilly? Tilly? Wake up, we need to get out of here!” The bloated girl was still unconscious. Lisa turned back to Stacy.

Stacy had a blond pony tail and strawberry pink skin. The six year old was doing the strangest thing. She had both of the pump tubes in her mouth and was sucking on the fattening juice with contentment.

“Little girl? Stacy? You’ve got to stop doing that. If you keep drinking that they’ll come back and capture you.” Lisa tugged at the youngster but the blubber belly remained routed right where she was.

Lisa risked a glance out to the hallway. Nobody was coming. She lifted Tilly up out of the chair. The woman wasn’t too heavy but she was waterlogged like a walrus. Lisa grunted as she shuffled over to the pumps. After a hysteric foray of button pushing she managed to turn off the machines. This got Stacy’s attention.

“Stacy,” Lisa said, trying to keep her voice calm. “The bad people are going to be back soon. We have to get away from here. Do you know a hiding spot?”

This registered with the tubby youth. She waddled out of the room like a penguin on steroids. Lisa draggled Tilly and the bloater’s book bag after her.

The maintenance hallway ended with a dead end. A variety of chutes aligned the wall. Laundry, Garbage, Waste Water…Stacy squirmed into the Waste Water chute. Soon only her feet stuck out of the chute door. For a moment Lisa thought the portly female was stuck but then she slowly slide down, due to the slime that had built up in the walls.

Lisa frowned at the chute. It didn’t seem like a reliable means of escape. She could hear the quiet slush sound as Stacy slid down at tortoise pace. If a 130-pound six year old could fit through it, it darn well better manage two adult women.

After waiting a minute to allow Stacy to travel enough distance, Lisa struggled to stuff Tilly into the chute. The bloated twenty year old also filled up the cavity with her swelled gut but she slide down just faster than Stacy. Last, and truly the ‘least’ of the trio, Lisa climbed into the cute and slid into the darkness...

Lisa sat at the entrance to a cave, watching the sun set. She must have walked five miles dragging Tilly along before Stacy, the obese youngster, had stopped at the entrance to a shallow cave. She had instinctively led them to that spot. Had the young girl been here before? It was hard to tell.

Tilly stirred, emerging from her sleep. Lisa crawled over to where she had laid the unconscious woman. “Tilly?”

“Got any maple syrup?” The orange haired girl whispered.

“Huh? No!”

“How about some ice tea?”

Lisa rummaged through Tilly’s bag of drinks. She handed a bottle of Brisk to her tired friend. “Figures you would need something like this.”

Tilly quaffed the tea as if she had survived through a drought. After a minute she spoke. “So, what did I miss?”

“You got captured by that security guard and the school’s doctors were going to run tests on you because you’re a bloater. Then I get caught and we would have shared the same fate if this little girl hadn’t shown up.”

“Little girl?” Tilly asked, confused.

“Well, I guess none of the students at the institution are ‘little,’ but we were rescued by their resident 130-pound-six-year-old-escape-artist.” Lisa pointed to where Stacy sat a few feet away.

The area around the cave was littered with apple trees. Stacy had spent the past few hours eating all the apples she could reach. A sizable pile of cores sat beside her. She ate an entire apple in seconds before chucking it to the side.

“She hasn’t said a single word this whole time,” Lisa explained. “All she has done is eat.”

“Can you blame her?” Tilly groaned, rising to a sitting position. “They’ve conditioned her to stuff her face as much as she wants, hence why she tips the scales at 130. She’s probably experiencing mixed goals of eating and escaping. All this running around has made her hungry and apples are not the most filling things in the world.”

Stacy finished the last of her apples although Lisa was sure that the tot still wasn’t satisfied. She waddled over and sat next to them, viewing them as protective figures.

“What are we going to do with her?” Lisa asked. “Do you think that the Institute will try to look for her?”

“Maybe. If this girl has a previous track record of being mute they might just forget about her. If they had wanted to find her, they would have presumed that she could only walk a few miles and they would have found us by now.”

A squishy, queasy sound like the rumble of the train tracks erupted from Stacy’s exposed stomach. The kid hopped up and down on her rear in a fit.

“They do condition them well,” Tilly commented, rising. She unscrewed the lid from one of her liters of soda and passed it to the chubby girl. She sucked on it like a newborn pig.

“A girl after my own heart,” Tilly mused. “We’re going to have to hide her. It would also be a good idea if we lay low for a while.”

“Where can we go?” Lisa asked.

“Best and worst case scenario we hide up in my apartment, though I am going to need more food if we bring this blubber munchkin in to live with us. Unless…”

"Awesome!" Mike grinned widely, chubby face practically beaming. Apparently the establishment was a big favourite of his. "I should bulk up for that zine photo shoot, right?"

The teenager's own narrow face flushed red. "Some of the others, girls mostly for good reason, want to start a zine on the hottest things in town. Hottest restaurants, hottest clubs... And hottest boys," she muttered, eying Mike warningly. "Personally, I don't see why I should have to share him!"

He merely smiled at her jealousy. "You know yours is the only camera lens I pose for. Come on, Lisa, was it? You'll love this place. It's great."

The huge building was right next door to the school, and it looked more like a warehouse than a restaurant, being stark and metallic. Once they entered, however, the interior was more like a typical place like TGIF, despite the fact that all the chairs and booths looked massive and were crammed with people, mostly young people, who were many times the size of normal restaurant patrons.

There was also something else; like a modern informal Japanese sushi restaurant, there was a broad conveyor belt encircling the restaurant, passing all the seats. Instead of delicate sushi, however, there were multi-pattied burgers, hot dogs smothered in cheese and chili, calzones that must have been several pounds each, and steak sandwiches and greasy fries dripping with gravy.

"This is why they call it the burger factory," put in Flash as she pulled out her debit card to pay for the three of them. "My treat, I just got paid for my last project. It's cheap, anyway, and all you can eat. They save a ton of money by buying food in such great bulk. " They went to seat themselves, Mike nearly drooling at the sight of food. "Every once in a while a plain salad comes around, and it's not like anyone else here takes them, so I can usually get an okay dinner."

"But when we come here, it's all about me," smiled her boyfriend, sliding into a booth that was plenty wide even for him, waving at some people he obviously knew. He grabbed the first three burgers that passed him, setting in ravenously.

"There's also a soda and milkshake fountain at every table," Flash continued, taking one of the huge glasses and filling it up with a thick chocolate milkshake, pushing it towards Michael. "Luckily, no one likes plain water so it's always full for me."

"Er..." was all Lisa could come up with as she tentatively snagged a massive steak sandwich to at least eat something. Mike was already halfway into his second burger. Another thing very unique to this town, apparently...

"So... Who owns the Burger Factory?" questioned Lisa, glancing around. Music was playing dimly in the background, and based on the numerous nodding heads it was a popular tune in the town. The place was reasonably full with mostly young people, high school or university students, all of them what a normal person would consider massively obese. Besides the tiny Flash, Lisa was sure she was the lightest person in the building. "They sure know how to draw the crowds."

"Darla Smithson-Travis-Andrews-Reynolds," Mona parroted off with a slight chuckle. "Or, for short, Darla Star. I think she married her three husbands just to get that name, you know. She owns quite a few spots in town; the Burger Factory, Wide Wheel Pizza, Club XXXL, and Close East sportswear."

Lisa raised an eyebrow. "Sportswear? In this town?"

"Specifically sumo gear," mumbled Mike through the thick calzone he was nearly finished. It was his second, having practically inhaled the burgers. "She sponsors the high school's sumo team."

"His new team jacket is still being made, he grew out of the last one." Here the girl giggled slightly, filling up a fourth milkshake for her gorging beau and selecting two triple-patty bacon burgers for him to dive into once the calzone was devoured. "Like I said, she's had three husbands over the ten years she's been in town. All younger than her, she's got to be around forty-five now. First one was a buff guy that she had when she came here, I guess he left her after she 'settled in' to the town's standards. Second one lost a bunch of weight so she kicked him to the curb and he left town. The third... Well, supposedly they're still married, but no one's actually seen him in a long time... Of course, this is all things I've heard, I'm a fairly newcomer to the town."

"Been here all my life," put in the sumo hurriedly, gulping down more milkshake. "I've heard the same." His large stomach was expanding further with the onslaught of greasy food, pushing his once loose t-shirt out and making it fit tighter and tighter with each massive bite. He showed no signs of slowing down, however, and downed four thick milkshakes in a row before setting in ravenously on the food once more.

Flash watched all this adoringly, reaching over to rub his swelling middle lovingly. "Eat up, you've got the championships coming soon and more schools than ever are competing this year." Glancing at the reporter, she continued with "With the growing obesity numbers everywhere in the country, sumo's becoming more and more popular. And Mike here has to work extra hard to keep his reputation! I saw how hard you were hitting the weights, you at least need to gain back all those lost calories."

Nodding eagerly, the young man increased his pace, his girlfriend handing him fresh food and refilling his glasses as needed, leaving his hands entirely free to cart food from plate to mouth, a trip they made frequently.

"Hmm, maybe there's another person to try and interview," mused Lisa. And perhaps someone who was involved with a sumo team. Was it a professional sport here? And Flash had mentioned a club, what was the nightlife? There was so much she had to learn about this town, but on the bright side she had struck a journalism goldmine!

Looking over her notes and the questions she'd come up with before she'd even entered the town, she came across one she was honestly curious about. "Michael, I mean Mike, what was it like to grow up in a town like this? You mentioned you were born here...?"

"Yep, South Barkalow General Hospital," he nodded, actually taking a break from eating to answer her. He was polite in that way, even if he was practically drooling to get back to his feasting.

"Are children here born bigger than usual?"

"Not really, I was only seven pounds when I was born, my little sister, she's seven now, she was about the same. But...! Flash has done some research, this information is usually blocked from the town, there doesn't seem to be any more than the usual pregnancy difficulties even though obesity is supposed to be bad on pregnancies."

Scribbling this down, Lisa paused. "What do you mean by blocked information?"

"There mayor's office controls the media," sighed Mona, all of a sudden looking very downcast, not her chipper self. Mike patted her shoulder before she continued. "They decide which magazines and books come through. A lot of them are heavily edited to only put thin people in the roles of villains. Same with TV shows, and national news doesn't come in. The Internet in the town is loaded with proxies, it's the same stuff China uses, it blocks out a lot and people don't even realize."

"How do you know?"

Looking around her, the girl lowered her voice. "Look... I do like this town, but... Weird stuff goes on, and it gets overwhelming. There's a group of people, I can't introduce you for an interview, sorry, but we can get around stuff, but it doesn't really do much good."

"Try watching some television later," suggested Mike with a heavy shrug. "Flash tells me a lot of popular TV shows have actually been reshot with obese actors and rebroadcast here. She thinks they shoot here in town. And an awful lot of original programing does come out of here."

"On the bright side, there is a great indie movie scene," Flash added. "And I've got to admit, 'Fat Friends' does cut all most of the corny jokes out of 'Friends'. ' Big as a House MD' sucks, though; the patient's diagnosis is always that they need to gain more weight..."

"Don't get her started on CSI: Chubby Science Investigators," warned her boyfriend. "... 'Wading Pool Watch' is great."

"Alright, yeah, the actors are sexy," she was forced to admit, noticing Lisa's stunned look. "See what I mean? It's like a big fat conspiracy, no offense meant."

"None taken," Mike acknowledged, scarfing down some nachos before continuing. "But parenting magazines and shows encourage parents to feed their kids as much as they'll eat. Elementary and middle schools promote it, we're fed there three times a day and we got detention if we didn't eat it all. I mean, I like my size, but it's not really fair to people like Flash who would get really sick if she gained weight, or people who just don't want to be fat."

Lisa was nothing short of stunned! She had known the town was largely self-contained, but she had no idea it was to this extent!

11521121111.content:
"Well, thanks for the interview... can we talk later?" Lisa asked, putting away her notes. She couldn't help but look over her shoulder - this talk had made her paranoid.

"Sure, there's too much to relate at one time... but we'll have to be careful. Us skinny people are already looked on with suspicion," said Flash, lifting another burger to Mike's mouth. The pair waved goodbye as Lisa made her exit.

This can't be real, she thought to herself. Though the couple did seem quite sincere, it was all so hard to believe... maybe some television would help her sort this out. It must be an exaggeration, right?

She sought out the comfort of her hotel room... well, it wasn't all that comforting, really. She got suspicious, knowing looks from the obese desk clerk and the other staff milling about, and her room, though luxurious, was a reminder of how much she stood out - a person as big and hungry as Mike would fit right in perfectly here, since everything was larger, wider, and there was even an extra-big fridge for snacks and drinks.

Lisa felt like there were judging eyes on her all the time.

"This is silly," she sighed. "It's just a hotel room for larger people. I've heard about these things, it's nothing I couldn't find in any town with a lot of tourists."

She sat down on the bed, taking deep breaths. She kicked off her shoes and laid back, propping herself up to watch the big-screen TV. She felt a little better already.

She waggled the remote in front of her face and hit the button.

Her jaw dropped.

It was a news show. "Rachael Fatcow". A very large, lesbian-looking woman who was actually quite pretty, was delivering the news. She had the sensibility of a comedienne, though, and smirked her way through a few stories about how things weren't as great in other places as they were in South Barkalow.

Lisa was so stunned she forgot to copy down some notes. It was almost never that you saw a large person on television, and even more rare if their weight hardly came up at all (though, of course, Ms. Fatcow commented on the weight of others).

Lisa just jotted down a few things she noticed. It was all too bizarre to try and get the sheer shock across.

A few commercials came up. One was for the Burger Factory, showing a whole group of teens about Mike's size, chowing down and having fun. There were funny moments of them bumping bellies and making funny faces before they stuffed enormous burgers into their mouths. There was a plus-sized women's clothing store that... well, made it clear it was meant for a strictly adult clientele. And one commercial selling men's deodorant spray. It smelled like bacon and was supposed to attract the most obese of women to the wearer.

"Gee, now even I want to put on a few pounds," Lisa rolled her eyes and hit the button.

The next show was The Biggest Winner Couples. Ten teams of couples - some married, some just dating - were competing to see who could become the largest. Lisa thought it was crazy how one couple was already quite big - probably 700 pounds combined! "We just want to look better for each other, and be good role models for our kids," explained one Mom who would be considered pleasantly plump anywhere but South Barkalow.

The next show was "How I Fed Your Mother", a sitcom where a guy was embarrassed by his too-thin girlfriend, but kept taking her out to decadent restaurants and cooking at home, trying to get her to put on a few pounds. Then "True Chub", a vampire romance. Only here, the vampires drank fat instead of blood, and most characters seemed more horrified about the involuntary liposuction instead of dying.

Lisa turned off the TV and threw her notes across the room. "I get it, I get it - fat is good!" She threw a pillow over her face and laid back in a huff. "I'll never figure out this town on my own, I need leads!"

She thought about Flash and her Fat Resistance group. But people already didn't trust her, it was obvious... maybe she could catch more flies with honey, as the saying went.

Lisa decided not to take the chance with the fat suit. Who knew, it might even be illegal in this town to impersonate a fat person! She'd just have to charm them, maybe convince them that she was gathering information on how other towns could match the "dedication to size” of South Barkalow. Putting on a crisp, brown pantsuit and a nice blouse, Lisa headed out from the hotel room armed with a small, discreet camera and her trusty notebook.

When she got to the mayor's office in the big town hall, the heavy-bottomed secretary was wary about her request to see Mayor Hutchins, but after a hushed conversation on the phone with him, she buzzed the journalist through.

Mayor Phillip Hutchins, as the nameplate on his desk proclaimed him to be, was one of the fattest people Lisa had seen, even after her time spent in the town! Sitting in the armless desk chair that seemed to be three times as wide as one an average person might use and reinforced with steel, there was little distinction between his chest and torso, he was just a nearly spherical ball of blubber with a neckless face and thick arms and legs attached (and even his limbs looked like they were retreating into his bulk).

“Miss Boytise,” the mayor rumbled, finishing off the last of the huge hoagie sandwich on his desk. Judging from the crumpled similar wrappers in his trashcan, it had not been his first one. “Very pleased to meet you.” He didn’t offer a handshake, merely waved that she sit down.

Lisa sat in one of the two chairs in front of his desk. Three more people her size could have shared the seat with her. “I’m very happy you could see me on short notice, Mayor Hutchins. I’m writing an article on your town and thought you’d be the best person to talk to.”

“I suppose that’s right,” he nodded, slurping from a water bottle that the reporter could see was filled with soda. “What specifically is your article on?”

“How your town has so much original programming. Local television is a huge issue nowadays. As is body image in the media, I understand that you portray people on your shows that wouldn’t even get a pilot in LA.”

His doughy face wrinkled into a frown. “How exactly do people so far away know about South Barkalow’s shows? None of them have been released on DVD yet.”

“Er… A lot of them have been uploaded onto the Internet. It’s illegal, so they take them down as soon as they’re up, but they still get around.” Hopefully he’d buy that, and wouldn’t look too hard for any online torrents of the programs. “They’ve gotten people excited.”

“Huh. Hopefully that will stop when we do release DVDs… Don’t want people just stealing them.”

“I’m sure people will buy them once they’re available,” Lisa encouraged. “I’m here to write an article on their production, hype them up a bit…”

“Well… It would be great publicity…” muttered the super obese mayor, drumming his spherical belly as he considered it.

"Nice to meet you," Lisa said, taking another slice. Guess that she was hear, she might as well enjoy the food here, even if she gained weight. 'Eh, when in roam.' she thought. "I'm Lisa."
"Nice to meet you," Jasmine greeted. "Now would you like to know more about me?"
Lisa nodded, still eating. "Yes. I want to know..."
1223111.title: Getting Information and a few Slices

choices: Lisa swallows her pride and goes on the date with Deric.
A large woman saves Lisa and tells romeo to scram.
124.content:
Lisa grunted as she lifted the heaviest piece of her luggage onto the bed. She unzipped it. Inside was a specially made body suit the company had given her for the investigation. It could be suspicious if a skinny woman was going around town asking people why they were so fat, so the company had provided her with a fat suit.

She unfurled the top and wriggled into it. The skin was amazingly realistic. It was basically made out of rubber and covered by a thing layer of latex. The thick padding had a blouse sewed into it. After arranging the top in the right way, she buttoned the blouse over her fake ‘saddlebags’ and ‘love handles.’

The legs of the fat suit were equally thick and jiggly. Instead of skin, the legs were covered by a pair of stretch jeans which had been fitted onto the suit. There were snaps on the waist that had to be secured to ones bellow her new fat stomach, or else the legs might fall down. That would blow Lisa’s identity.

After anchoring her legs to her gut, Lisa put on a blue sweater. It had to be a large, thick sweater that would cover the snaps and velcro of the suit. It covered her all the way from breast to waist. She pulled the collar of the blouse out so it hung over the collar of the sweater. To complete the ensemble, she adjusted a blond wig on her head and secured it with hairpins. She put on some thick framed glasses. Lastly, Lisa had to retie her shoes. This was a real struggle, as she was unused to the fat middle that prevented her from reaching her feet. Even sitting on the floor didn’t help the process but finally she tied her sneakers and her disguise was complete.

Lisa looked at herself in a mirror. Great. They sent her undercover as a fat librarian. They should have gone all out and included a checkered sweater. She didn’t look super fat but she did look thicker. No part of her new body was too large. Lisa’s old skinny figure could equate to a flagpole. This fat suit made her look much thicker, like a tree trunk. A really big tree trunk like an old pine or redwood.

She fiddled with her blouse under the sweater. Located by the left fake breast was a small microphone. The microphone was attached to a bulky recorder in a pouch under her new belly. It could hold up to eight hours of recorded audio. The activation button rested right by the tag of her sweater. Her other suitcase had more blank tapes in them. She was fully wired. Lisa grabbed her pen and pad and left.

Lisa had only walked as far as a block before she realized this was a big mistake. The fat suit was made out of material that also made excellent insulation and it was a hot summer’s day. Why did they make me wear a sweater, she moaned to herself. Her face was sweating profusely and she could feel the slimy layer of perspiration where her skin touched the inside of the suit. She spotted a nearby ice cream parlor. I have got to cool down, she thought as she hurriedly waddled over.

Of course, every building in the fattest town in the world had fully operational air conditioning. Lisa sighed with relief as the cool air hit her. A soda jerk looked at her from behind the counter. “Do you want something, miss?”

“No I—” Lisa started, then she stopped. You’re going overheat in this dumb thing if you don’t do something about it. “I’ll have a small vanilla milkshake.”

“Will do. $1.75.”

She paid him and then sat down at a booth. Although Lisa was glad to be sitting she was unaccustomed to her new, well padded behind. She struggled to make herself more comfortable.

The soda jerk gave her the milkshake. Despite her discomfort she giggled. A ‘small’ milkshake in South Barkalow was the same size as a ‘large’ anywhere else. She took a swig and immediately felt cooler. She was surprised at how quickly she guzzled the milkshake until there was a quarter of it left.

Now that her sweat had dried the inside of her suit had gotten itchy. Screw this, she thought. I don’t care if people look at me funny for being skinny. After I’m done with the shake I’m going to go back to the apartment and take this dumb thing off—

“Dang, girl, you look mighty fine!” Lisa would’ve jumped from her seat if she could. A young black man had suddenly appeared in the seat in front of her. He looked like Fat Albert, almost out of high school. He couldn’t have been more than nineteen.

“Oh-h,” Lisa stammered. “Uh-h, who—”

“Oh, pardon me for not introducing myself. The name is Deric, with an ‘ic’ at the end instead of an ‘ek.’ I just had to come by and say that you had a dang fine figure.”

“T-thank you?” Lisa replied. This fat suit was supposed to make her blend in, and suddenly it had drawn all the fat Casanovas out of the woodwork.

“So, uh…Miss?”

“Lisa.” She kicked herself for not using a fake name.

“So Lisa…Can I have your number? Can I have it?”

“M-my number? I don’t have a number; I’m just passing through.”

“Ooooooohhhhhhhhhhh…” The ‘oh’ lasted for almost ten seconds. “You’re new around here, huh? Then I really got to take you out and show you the town. Does it sound like a date, girl?”

Lisa was mortified. How did this happen? Even if she was desperate for a story she wouldn’t go out with him. Deric was incredibly annoying.

But wait, her inner thoughts reminded her. You are trying to see why South Barkalow is the fattest town ever. Why not sneak into the dating scene and see how they do things around here?
124.title: Under the Flab

choices: She has to run, no matter how bad things get!
Deric notices that she's wearing a fat suit!
The waiter brings dessert! Equally scary!
1241.content:
Lisa meekly followed Deric into a dark but loud restaurant. During the ride in his ‘pimped-out car’ which was nothing more than a Saturn with rims, Deric had talked like a nonstop chatterbox. Lisa could not understand a word he was saying. She hoped that she had nodded her head at the right moments.

A hostess showed them to a couple’s booth. The booths were built to accommodate large frames. Lisa wiggled in, still not used to moving around in the fat suit. Deric shooched in with remarkable speed and put his arm around her shoulder. “Hope you like BBQ, baby. This place is famous for it!”

She tried to smile, although it was more of a cringe.

A waiter came by. “What would you like to drink?”

“Root beer, man!” said Deric. “Nothing better! What you want, baby?”

“I-I’ll just have some water…”

“Nah, she ain’t thirsty for just water! Bring the lady some lemonade.”

A minute later the waiter returned with the beverages. He placed a pitcher of root beer by Deric and one of lemonade by Lisa. Interesting, Lisa thought. Restaurants her give a pitcher of beverage per person. She wished that she could reach for her pad of paper, but Deric had her griped to tight.

She tried to make the best of it. “S-so…do you ever wonder why everyone in this town is so…big?”

“You mean fat?” He smiled his goofy, irritating smile. “You can say fat, girl.” He suddenly stood up, raising a glass of root beer that he had just poured for himself. He shouted so all the other patrons could hear him. “South Barkalow fat is the way to be at! Ain’t that right?”

A few other diners returned his cheer. Lisa blushed with embarrassment under the gaze of so many jolly fat folk. The waiter came back. “What would you like to order?”

“We can split the Lovers’ Dinner 4 Two,” Deric replied before Lisa could open her mouth. “Think you can handle that, baby?”

“S-sure…”

Deric wasn’t really listening for her answer. “Chop! Chop, man! The girl’s dying for some food over here!”

Lisa groaned as she sat through another of Deric’s endless tirades, unable to get her own word in. Luckily her mike was turned on. Maybe she could review the tape later in hopes that Deric had actually said something newsworthy. She could only sit there with worry. She wasn’t a fat girl, another one of South Barkalow’s plump prime.

“You really are an insensitive girl,” Deric remarked with his goofy grin.

“W-w-what?!”

“I’ve been pinching your fine junk in the trunk for the past five minutes and you haven’t budged a bit.”

She jumped, more from the shock of Deric pinching her but than his actual action of doing so.

“I-I’ve got slow reflexes,” she replied. This was enough to cause Deric to laugh for five minutes. Of course she couldn’t feel anything under the suit. Sooner or later Deric was going to realize that she was wearing a fat suit. What would happen then?

Finally the waiter came with the food. Lisa’s eyes bulged from behind her glasses. The manhole sized plate was covered with two whole racks of BBQ ribs, a mountain of fries and three ears of corn. The waiter sat it down in front of Deric, who was licking his lips. Her heart sank to her stomach when another waiter came by…and gave her a plate identical to Deric’s.

This was the Lovers’ Dinner 4 Two?! Deric sure acted like it was. His big jaws had already bitten off one bone from his ribs. He talked with his mouth full. “Eat up girl, there’s plenty to go around! I’ll even give you some of my fries if you want them.”

That was not going to happen. Back home Lisa had barely managed to finish one of the rib dinners at Applebee's. She had never contemplated eating this much food in her life. It seemed impossible to do but she had created a persona she had to upkeep.

It was obvious that Lisa was a slow eater by South Barkalow standards. She was getting full from one rack of ribs and two ears of corn just as Deric finished his entire meal. His goofy grin slipped a few notches as he noticed her pace. “You sure eat slow, baby. Is everything alright?”

“I-I’ve just been on the road for so long, so I’ve had to skip meals…” she stammered, trying to swallow the BBQ meat.

“Oh, I know just what’s wrong with you then.” Deric somehow managed to scoot in closer when they had previously been separated by inches of fat and blubber suit. Lisa felt the suit becoming too hot again. He broke off some of her ribs and held them up to her mouth. “You just haven’t been able to do upkeep, so your body is not used to your regular meal sizes. Don’t worry, Deric will feed you.”

She opened her mouth to decline but Deric shoved the ribs into her mouth. She was forced to chew the meat off or choke. He moved the corn cob across her lips so she could chew. He inserted the rest of her fries, one by one, into her mouth. Then he cut the remaining pig off the bones and forked bites into her mouth. The last bit of BBQ pork entered her mouth. “There, isn’t that better?”

Lisa wanted to puke. Her stomach was stretched beyond full, and the fat suit felt too restrictive.

The waiter came back to clear the plates. “What would you like for dessert?”

“A slice of the Quintuple Chocolate Cake apiece. Nothin’ better!”

Lisa gagged at the prospect of more food.

“What’s wrong, baby? Ooohhh, that’s right, you haven’t been able to eat this much in a while. Deric will fix you right up.”

She froze. Deric had started massaging her middle! She couldn’t really feel it. The Fat Albert wannabe seemed to enjoy gripping the rubber padding.

His goofy grin lit up. “Man, girl, you’re nice and squishy! But no wonder you’re full, you got a hard mass sitting right here…”

She sat there horrified. His hands were patting around the tape recorder. Soon he would realize what it was and her cover would be blown. What to do?!
1241.title: The Most Uncomfortable Date Ever

choices: Read the newspaper.
Watch the news on TV.
12411.content:
Lisa couldn’t stand the embarrassment of making a scene, but she was sure that the public knowledge of her wearing a fat suit would be worse. She squirmed out of the booth.

“I’m sorry Deric but I have to…to…” she stammered. Unable to say any more she rushed off towards the bathroom.

Deric was right behind her, a fat man surprisingly quick on his feet. “What’s wrong, baby? Is the food? My shirt? My B.O.? I can take shower if I have to, baby.”

She slammed through the door to the woman’s bathroom. Backdoor, she thought. Please let there be a back door…There was another entrance to the bathroom that led from the bar side of the restaurant. She hurtled towards the nearest door to the outside.

Once the sunlight hit her face she ran even faster, afraid that Deric would have noticed her exit and chase after her. This was the incorrect thing to do. Lisa was in good shape, but she wasn’t used to running while her body carried an extra forty or so pounds of rubber. Her skin became slick with sweat and she was forced to lean against a wall and wheeze. Luckily, the restaurant wasn’t too far from her apartment. She speed walked the rest of the way in agony.

Finally she managed to unlock the door to the apartment. When she had the privacy she ripped off the suit much faster than she had put in on. She crammed it under the bed, out of sight. The strain made her sweat even more. She wanted to take a shower, to get all of the sweat off of her. And all the Deric germs…

She almost shrieked when the sound of knocking came from her door. Quaking in fear, she sneaked over and looked in the peep hole. An immense policeman stood on the other side, comically spherical because of the lens.

Lisa opened the door slowly. “H-hello?”

“Sorry to bother you, miss.” The cop touched his cap. “We’re looking for a woman with a large blue sweater and glasses that was seen running away from a restaurant. She was seen entering this apartment complex. Have you seen her?”

Of course, the cops would be looking for a fat woman. “N-no. I’ve had the door closed all day.”

The cop grabbed a doughnut from the bag he was carrying. He chewed it, crumbs spewing everywhere. “Not to worry, miss. Just give us a call if you notice her. It’s quite the crime to run away without paying for your food.”

Lisa gulped. “I-is it a bad crime?”

“Oh, the punishment is nothing major. But it’s a still a horrible crime in these parts. Good day, miss.”

Lisa closed the door and then collapsed against it. Well, she definably wasn’t going to wear that fat suit again. If she ran into Deric hopefully he wouldn’t recognize her. Still, it would be safe to hide out for the rest of the day.

She glanced around the meager apartment. She should do what research should could from here. She needed to find some interesting lead to go on.
12411.title: She has to run, no matter how bad things get!

124112.content:
“That fat suit was a disaster,” Lisa comments to herself, “I’m never doing that again!”

She decides to try a more normal way of gaining information… watching the news on TV. She plops down on the sofa in front of the TV and turns it on with the remote.

“In other news, a town wide manhunt is in progress for a woman that committed the despicable crime of leaving a restaurant without paying. Eyewitnesses describe her as…” The morbidly obese anchorman on TV gives a perfect description of what Lisa looked like in her fat suit disguise.

“A town wide manhunt?!” Lisa repeats in disbelief. In a town full of fatties, they must take dining and ditching very seriously! Well, at least they won’t recognize her without the fat suit on.

The anchorman says…
124112.title: Watch the news on TV

choices: Lisa risk walking around as her normal self.

1241122.content:
“However,” the anchorman continued, “the police believe that this mysterious diner-ditcher is really just someone in a fat suit. For more on the story we take you live with our field reporter Bernice.”

Lisa almost fainted at the anchorman’s words. The scene shifted to a sidewalk where two people were standing. Lisa recognized the police man who had just knocked on her door. The female reporter, Bernice, was simultaneously top heavy and bottom heavy. Her bright pink pantsuit looked a little small in some places. Bernice was eating something. When she realized the camera was pointed in her direction, she frantically wiped some powder from her mouth. It seemed the cop had offered her some of his doughnuts.

She swallowed the doughnut. “B-Bernice VanSteenbergen, 10X News. I’m standing here with Chief Borden of the SBPD. Chief, you now believe that the diner-ditcher was someone in a fat suit. What brought you to this conclusion?”

Borden talked as he finished eating, spraying crumbs all over Bernice’s microphone. “Well, the major tip-off was that the suspect ran away from the scene. In this town, nobody runs away from any crimes. Usually, diner-ditching is an involved set-up where one member of the criminal party waits outside with a getaway vehicle. We all know the average citizen isn’t built for running. And seeing how this thick woman wasn’t a part of the police department, fire brigade, or high school track team, it’s obvious that she isn’t as fat as she appears to be.”

“Could the suspect be someone from out of town?” Bernice asked.

“Possibly. I can’t think of too many town citizens that masquerade in fat suits, unless they wear them out of self pity.”

“How is your investigation coming along so far?”

“We’ve made quick progress, if that’s what you’re asking. We were told that the suspect had just finished consuming the Lovers’ Dinner 4 Two at the local Bubba Que’s barbeque restaurant. Now, I don’t care if you’re fat, skinny, or athletic, but nobody can run too far after eating one of those dinners.”

Lisa let out a moan. Chief Borden was right. A meal that size should have left Lisa immobile. Only adrenalin and fear had managed to keep her moving, and now the pain in her gut had returned.

“We know which direction the suspect ran,” Chief Borden continued, “so we’ve approximated the distance she could’ve gone. Men on foot are now searching the homes, apartments, and businesses in the area.”

Bernice cut in. “That’s right, folks. Behind us is an apartment complex the chief himself has just finished checking.”

The hard mass of dinner in Lisa’s stomach froze. This live news footage was being filmed right in front of her apartment complex. The policeman had only knocked on her door a few minutes ago.

“Any ideas as to the identity of the suspect? Could it be male or female?”

“I suppose anyone could pretend to be a woman with a fat suit,” Chief Borden answered. “But I suspect a female. The Facial Reconstruction Unit is now working with witnesses to draw the suspect’s face. We hope to match that to any skinny people or out-of-towners that are taking residence in the grid we are searching.”

Panic surged through Lisa’s body. She jumped to her feet, even though she was technically too stuffed to move. Her thought were frantic. No! Now they know what I look like in a fat suit and soon they’ll know what I look like skinny! How am I going to continue my work? I will I get out of here without being noticed?

She glanced at her bed, which had the infernal fat suit under it. It’s really a question of whether I want to wear that thing again or not…there must be something I can do…

It was ridiculous, Lisa thought miserably as she was led into a line up of four other women. Some of them looked quite similar to her, she had to admit. There was one who had the same stunning blue eyes as her. There was another who had dark hair in a similar cropped style. There was even one who looked close to being her twin. But the similarities ended there, because each one of those women were at least 350lbs bigger than her. Lisa shrank between two of the big beauties, her hands still handcuffed behind her back.

It felt like ages before the door opened again, and a couple of portly officers waddled their way towards her. Lisa groaned as she was grabbed between them, and marched from the line up. "They picked you out, skinny," one officer spat, "You're gonna pay for this. You won't be Dinin' an Dashin' anytime soon." Lisa gasped as she felt herself being led down towards the cells, the rooms were more the size of small apartments, given how generously sized their occupants were. She was thrown into an empty one near the end, her handcuffs finally removed from her wrists.

"It was a mistake," Lisa pleaded as she ran to the bars, curling her fingers about them, "Please! I'll pay for everything!" One officer shook her head as she stood in front of Lisa's cell, her stomach jiggling menacingly.

"You want to know the punishment for Dining and Dashing?" she questioned lowly as she looked Lisa in the face, "In this town, you'll..."

How she was able to grab it and take it out was unknown to her. The police lady flipped through the small note book as best as her chubby fingers good. choices: ‘Why is this town trying to make us fat?’
‘Is  SBU’s headmaster really some puppet of a sinister corporation?’
12411222.content:
Maybe if I just make a few changes to the suit I can pretend to be a different person. Lisa pulled out all of her suitcases and spread the contents onto the bed. Unfortunately, the fat suit had been designed to have only one outfit. The police report had described her blue sweater, so that was out. She fumed. That didn’t leave her with many options. Unless…

First, Lisa needed a new hairdo. The wig wasn’t going to work. The only useful thing she had in her luggage was a bottle of hair dye. She spent the next fifteen minutes turning her hair a vivid midnight black. Unlike the wig, she could pattern her hair into a different style. It had to obscure her face, because it was the most telling part of her body as she had no way of adding chubby cheeks. After the dye settled in, she straightened her normally frizzy hair. She let it hang over her face, but to be different she clumped some hair from the back of her head into a ponytail.

Next, she had to struggle into the stupid suit again. She pulled the fat legs up to her waist. The jeans were fused to the suit, so she couldn’t take them off. Lisa rummaged through her clothes until she found one of her favorite purple skirts. It was a birthday present from a cousin, who had accidentally purchased it in a larger size. There was plenty of stretch-room in its waistband.

Lisa brought it up around her hips. It just managed to fit around the top of the jeans. The skirt on pants look wasn’t too fashionable these days, but Lisa was more worried about alteration than practicality.

Lisa changed so that she was wearing a light t-shirt. She stuffed a few pillows into the shirt and then put on the top of the fat suit. It felt extremely awkward, but it did make her look bigger. The police would ignore a woman fatter than they suspected, right? The blouse, like the pants, was inseparable so she had to cover it with something. At the bottom of her suitcase was a hooded sweatshirt she had packed for days when it could be cold. It was baggy, and managed to cover the ensemble better that the blue sweater.

Lisa looked at herself in the mirror. The extra padding made her look bigger, which was the most desired effect. Surprisingly she looked younger, as if she was still in college. Still, something was lacking. She put on a large pair of sunglasses. She found a light jacket, which trailed down the small of her back but obviously she wouldn’t be able to close it. At least it could be used for show.

Lisa hoped that she wasn’t overdoing things. But maybe by drawing attention to herself in this ridiculous getup, people would notice that she didn’t look a thing like the dinner-ditcher plaguing the news.

It was only when she got outside that she remembered how warm the day was. All the layers she was wearing only tripled the stifling heat that she felt inside her costume. You’re going to have to take things slow, Lisa thought to herself, or you could overheat in this thing. She walked slowly, but still sweat formed on her brow.

If Lisa had been anywhere else, people surely would have gawked at her size and manner of dress but in the fattest town in the world that was not the case. She became another unremarkable face in the crowd.

She gasped as she saw to uniformed officers up ahead at the corner. They were still canvassing the neighborhood, looking for her in a fat suit. Courage, Lisa, you can do this. She walked within an arm's reach of them to push the crosswalk button on the traffic light. The light changed six seconds later. She walked across, and then risked a glance behind her. The cops didn’t even give her a second glance.

She sighed with relief but that only reminded her how hot she was. Luckily, she stood just outside the entrance to a coffee shop. Like the ice cream parlor she had been in an hour or so earlier, the cool air of the coffee shop was instantly refreshing. Few people sat at tables or couches. Just like everywhere else in the US, the coffee shop hosted college age clientele. Was there really a college in South Barkalow? She would have to check that later.

“Oh lord.” The stout, brown skinned barista eyed Lisa’s outfit. She spoke with a thick accent that was hard to place. “Girl, you’re going to bake in those clothes if you aren’t careful.”

Something in Lisa snapped. She was tired of all the negative attention and awkward situations she was getting in today. “Yeah, but if it takes eleven minutes per pound I think I have a long wait until that happens!” As the words left her mouth Lisa wanted to slap herself. Where had that attitude come from?

The barista actually laughed. “You don’t seem too familiar. Did you transfer to SBU?”

“Huh?” Lisa grunted.

“South Barkalow University. It’s a great place to go, if you’re searching for colleges.” The barista did look like a part-time student. Lisa felt a little unnerved that her new disguise was attracting the overweight of the college age. Still, it was better than attracting Deric.

“What do you want?” The barista asked.

“Iced Mocha, large.” Given the concept of ‘large’ drinks in South Barkalow, the slushy concoction better cool her off. Lisa paid for it a minute later.

Lisa carefully perched herself on a stool, sucking the frozen drink as if it were life water. At least the disguise was working but it was still too hot and she still didn’t have any idea where to start her investigation. Maybe the local college could hold something…

Ding! The coffee shop bell jingled. A young woman shorter and stouter than the barista entered. In her hand was a stack of orange flyers that she passed out to the customers drinking coffee. She handed one to Lisa.

“Oh, I like you outfit,” she said.

“Uh, thanks.” As the girl left Lisa glanced at the piece of paper. The letters SBU dominated the top half. It advertised some meeting that was going to take place in the college. This looks interesting. Maybe I can use this. Lisa read the flyer.

‘Four o’clock, don’t miss the greatest thing ever to grace SBU’s MacDonald Hall! We have answers to all the questions: ’
12411222.title: Fugitive

choices: Lisa falls asleep, the fat sets in.
Lisa watches TV
12413.content:
Lisa gasps as the waiter brought the dessert over. In each hand was a massive chocolate cake Lisa guessed to be bigger than her own head. It was covered in a thick layer of chocolate icing. Lisa gagged at the prospect of eating it all. "I...I'm not too hungry." Lisa stammered. "Nonsense." mumbled Deric with his mouth full. Half of his cake was gone. Lisa watched as he shoved the rest of it into his mouth and swallowed. "Now, let me help you." he smiled. "No, I can eat it myself." Lisa said quickly, not wanting his greasy, fat fingers touching her food again.

***30 minutes later***

Lisa swallowed the last bite of the cake and fell back, panting. Her stomach felt as though it would burst and the fat suit fell as though it would rip off at any minute. "You okay there?" Deric asked. "I'm fine." Lisa gasped. "Well, how 'bout coming back to my place?" Deric asked sleazily. "NO!" Lisa said. "I mean.. I don't feel well. I think I'll go home." "Okay..." said Deric sadly. "I already paid, but before you leave, what's your number?" "Uh..." Lisa stammered. She didn't want to give him her number! Lisa randomly said a fake number and he wrote it down. "Thanks, bye." he said leaving.

1333.content:
South Barkalow City Hall was really unlike any other Town Hall Lisa had seen. There was no colonial architecture here--no Corinthian columns or red bricks, nothing faux-Gothic or faux-Renaissance. In fact, Lisa would have walked right past the building, assuming it to be a massive restaurant or department store, if it hadn't said "South Barkalow Town Hall" in great, crimson block letters across its plastic facade. There was a working clock above the letters, but it was digital.

Wow, Lisa thought, this town's buildings were as massive and tacky as its residents.

Nevertheless, the great, boxy building was impressive in its own way--as a testimony to the cultural black hole that was former Small-Town America. It had, she supposed, been built--or renovated--sometime in the 1990s, when the town had split off from North Barkalow due to a dispute over regulatory measures of some kind that the state government had implemented. She'd never been too great at understanding this bureaucratic small-town stuff--Need-To-Know News was hardly The Economist, and she wasn't, truth be told, the best reporter--so after a certain amount of time scouring the Web to learn about the background of the town, she decided that a man-on-the-street perspective would be more interesting to her readers, and it sure as hell would to her.

"All right, Lisa," she muttered to herself. "You know what to do..."

Luckily, Lisa noted, with mingled awe and consternation, there was a very well-dressed woman striding toward her. Her auburn hair hung down over her shoulder (as was the style) in one lustrous pleat, and was complemented by amber jewelry. She wore the most feminine-looking business jacket Lisa had ever seen, and under it bloomed a dark-brown skirt that was pulled up over the woman's generous middle. Her rather full lips were pursed, and she glowered at Lisa, not so much due to Lisa's staring as to the fact that the suddenly mild-mannered reporter was in her path. Lisa had never seen a woman so large and fast before--the businesswoman must have been 250 pounds, but she walked faster than Lisa could have, scowling all the while.

What does Lisa do?

13332.content:
The words, "Pardon me, ma'am, can I talk to you about South Barkalow," rose and died on Lisa's lips. This Amazon did not want to be bothered, and how was Lisa even to broach the subject of obesity with her? Rather than speak to the woman, she dove out of her way, watching her loose dress flap around her beefy legs from behind. "Careful, Skinny," called the woman without turning her head. In a surprisingly short amount of time, she was out of sight.

Lisa had, in fact, never seen anyone so large before until she had boarded the bus that morning. The so-called "Obesity Epidemic" in America had run its course in the 20-teens--thanks in large part to the efforts of the FDA and CDC. People, everyone said, were healthier than ever, thanks to controlled diets and government-mandated exercise programs. South Barkalow, of course, was the big exception--and it seemed that as the rest of the country got thinner, this strange little town, along with a few others, had increased in girth. There was a kind of morbid fascination with South Barkalow because of this, though oddly enough, she had never seen any serious news agency do a piece on the town. The official line was that the government had cured obesity everywhere, despite silly, wild rumors of towns full of obese throwbacks.

Rumors that were, apparently, true. Yet it was difficult to interview obese people about their disease, she thought. How do you ask someone how they feel about being fat? And was it her, or did everyone in this town seem distinctly unfriendly, as if they disliked her on sight? Perhaps she could find someone who wasn't fat to interview first? She could have, she supposed, begin with City Hall...but the mayor and public officials would be sure to spin the story to make the town look as good as possible, and she wanted something real, something candid. She scanned the buildings that made up the downtown skyline...in addition to offices, there were a ton of restaurants. As she began to move toward these, it slowly registered that she had not heard of any one of them before. They had strange names like "IHOP," "Bob's Big Boy," "Cinnabon," "Country Cookin'" and "Dairy Queen." They all, strangely enough, looked like chain restaurants--but the more popular chains she'd grown up with--such as "Leafy Greens," or "Fit and Well" were nowhere to be seen. That could be a story as well, she thought. She continued to walk down the Main Street, which was empty of people, aside from the occasional businessman leaving work early and hefting his bulk into one of the cars that lined the street (she smiled, imagining them on their way to secret rendezvous with zaftig mistresses in seedy, big-bedded motels). The strangest thing about it was that when she did see someone, they never so much as made eye contact with her. She thought that, as the only thin person in a town, she would at least attract some stares. Not a bit of it. It was either as though her 24-inch waist made her instantly invisible--or else as though they'd been instructed not to look at her. Either theory was crazy, though. She turned the corner--and immediately laughed in astonishment.

What does Lisa see?

133321.content:
"No way!" Lisa almost shouted, seeing a restaurant chain that she recognized after all. A double arch seemed to appear to her out of nowhere as she turned a corner, so yellow it was practically glowing. Underneath, a sign: "Thousands Served."

She had learned all about this one in history class, and her mother even said they'd gone a few times when she was a baby. "Of course, in those days, no one knew how bad it was for you," her mother would always say, by way of excuse. The company--she'd always thought--had been shut down by the government in the late teens as a chief contributor to the obesity epidemic. Perhaps all the other restaurants she'd seen as well--perhaps this was where they went to die? Geez, she thought--between the fat people, the fast food restaurants, and all the corporate kitsch, South Barkalow was feeling more and more like a trip back in time. She wondered if McDonald's had "Happy Meals" for adults, and she was about to go inside and find out, when she noticed another establishment next door that was familiar, although not for nostalgia's sake. She went to "Yogafit" every week to satisfy her federal workout requirement. She was a bit surprised to find one in South Barkalow, but then, in the wake of the changes brought on by Affordable Care, working out had quickly become a government mandate. There were several fitness joints--from yoga studios to old-fashioned gyms--in every town, borough and suburb. Why would South Barkalow be exempt?

Where does Lisa go?

1333212.content:
Surely if there were skinny people anywhere in South Barkalow, Lisa thought, they would be here. She could get the story from them, first, then talk to some of these fatties in order to "flesh" it out.

In Lisa's experience, normally, someone greeted you as soon as you walked in the door of Yogafit with "Namaste," but when she entered this establishment, she was a bit taken aback to find it as empty as the streets she'd just walked down. "Hello?" she called. She heard footsteps in the back office, which was behind the reception desk. At length, a man in a Yogafit uniform opened the door and walked to the desk.

To Lisa's relief, there wasn't an inch of fat on him--though he certainly wasn't very attractive, either, being mostly bald. At least, he wasn't attractive by her usual standards, though in South Barkalow, she supposed, he must be something of an Adonis. "Hey, sorry to keep you waiting," he said. "My name's Cody, and I'll be your--"

The man stopped short, taking in Lisa's figure. "I---wow--uh, sorry, ma'am."

Lisa smiled. To an extent, she was used to this kind of treatment. While she wasn't a great reporter, she could often rely on her charms to get access to information that other reporters just didn't seem to be able to get. Of course, to this poor little personal trainer, her charms were multiplied, as she was, as far as he was concerned, the only eligible woman in South Barkalow. "You'll be my what, Cody?" she laughed. Go on--you were doing well!"

Cody looked flustered. Sitting for days on end in an empty yoga studio had obviously had an impact on the poor guy's professionalism. She could take advantage of that. "Are, uh, you from around here?" asked poor Cody, almost rubbing his eyes after taking in her form again.

"I was JUST about to ask you the same question, Cody," said Lisa.
